rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

88064.name: The Town of Ardhmen
88064.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Secrets of Sarlona

The port town of Ardhmen in Syrkarn is a welcome sight for those making the months-long sea voyage from Khorvaire. Even so, a first impression of this ramshackle collection of fishing huts, tents, and patchwork buildings can leave explorers somewhat underwhelmed. Ardhmen is more than it appears, however, as detailed by designer Scott Fitzgerald Gray.

rpgseries.8869: Wizards of the Coast - Free Adventure Downloads

88065.name: Jungle Secrets
88065.description:
From the PDF introduction

An Adventure for Four to Six 10th-Level Characters

Secrets of Xen'drik opened up the unknown continent of Xen’drik, which we first read about in the Eberron Campaign Setting. While not every nook and cranny of the vast continent revealed itself in this relatively recent tome, more than enough information exists to allow for adventure and exploration. Xen’drik, an exciting place full of dangers and wondrous new cre a t u res and constructs, could become a home away from home for those jaded with the lands of Khorvaire or those seeking the unknown. Those so minded may wish to set sail by ship (dangerous) or airship (not as dangerous, but still not without risk) to Stormreach.

Jungle Secrets, an adventure for four to six 10th-level player characters (PCs), offers a window into the history of the giant-drow conflict and the remnants of the quori invasion. The adventure begins with the PCs already deep within the jungles of Xen’drik, and it takes them even farther into unexplored terrain. This adventure serves as a side trek to a main adventure, though it could be the start of a larger adventure or mini-campaign as well. Sidebars offer suggestions for modifying the adventure for 8th- and 12th-level PCs.

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

88066.name: Caves of Ancient Secrets
88066.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Return to the Temple of Elemental Evil Web Enhancement

Return to the Temple of Elemental Evil offers an epic adventure that takes characters from 4th to 14th levels. Caves of Ancient Secrets contains additional encounters designed to be played with that adventure. This small section of caverns, older than The Temple of All-Consumption (see Part 2 of Return to the Temple) is played during Chapter 5: The Crater Ridge Mines. It climaxes in a meeting with the half-fiend aboleth who took over the role of the Master from the current Second of the Triad (see Chapter 6: The Inner and Outer Fanes).

The bonus material in the Caves of Ancient Secrets web enhancement adds to the background and theme of the entire Return to the Temple of Elemental Evil adventure. It’s exclusive to the Wizards of the Coast website.

88067.name: Ruined Gatehouse
88067.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Deep Horizon

The DUNGEONS & DRAGONS adventure Deep Horizon is the sixth of eight adventures designed to take character from the beginning to advanced levels of play. This mini-adventure can be added easily to any campaign or used when playing with the Deep Horizon adventure, and it should work nicely with a group of four PCs of about 13th level. You will need a copy of the Deep Horizon adventure to run the desmodus, however.

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

88068.name: Expanded Psionics Handbook: Psionic Character Sheets
88068.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Expanded Psionics Handbook

The Deluxe Character Sheets accessory has lots of character classes and spell lists for your D&D characters -- but what about psionic characters? This Expanded Psionics Handbook web enhancement adds the Egoist, Kineticist, Nomad, Psychic Warrior, Seer, Shaper, Soulknife, Telepath, and Wilder to the lineup.

This first group of character sheets is in PDF format and intended to be printed on four sheets of 8 1/2" by 11" paper. They are suitable for typical home printers.

DOWNLOAD

This group of character sheets is in PDF format and intended to be printed on 11"x17" paper in landscape format. Print them double-sided, and they'll fit right in with the other deluxe character sheets in your folder.

DOWNLOAD

88069.name: Rescue on Ruie
88069.description:
From the cover page:

Sergei hault-Oberlindes, son of Baron Marc hault-Oberlindes of Feri (Spinward Marches 2005), trade magnate and owner of Oberlindes Lines, has been imprisoned by an anti-Imperial nation on Ruie (Spinward Marches 1809). Unable to make any progress through official channels, the Baron turns to unofficial means, and the characters are contracted to rescue Sergei.

88070.name: Rocket Rangers (Mini Six)
88070.description: Rocket Rangers! is a light-hearted pulp science fantasy campaign inspired by comics such as Flash Gordon and Buck Rogers, the Mars and Venus novels of Edgar Rice Burroughs, and sci-fi movies and television shows from the 1950s and ‘60s such as Forbidden Planet, Lost in Space, and Captain Video. The focus is on fun and excitement rather than scientific accuracy. Crazy retro gadgets, weird creatures, sexy alien princesses (or princes), and unlikely civilizations are all par for the course.

88071.name: The Malay Coins (Savage Worlds)
88071.description:
Product blurb:
After inadvertently foiling a museum robbery, Our Heroes get caught up in a race to recover seven mysterious coins which, when put together, show the way to a fabulous, long-lost treasure! After acquiring the coins they proceed to the Orient to try to recover the treasure, only to run afoul of Li-Ming Jade, Pirate Queen of the South China Sea!

88072.name: The Valley of Mystery
88072.description:
Product blurb:

When a package arrives from an old friend the heroes discover the skull of a saber-toothed tiger and an invitation to participate on an expedition into the Stone Age. But when the heroes arrive in Africa they are horrified to discover their good friend missing and his apartment ransacked. Now the heroes must travel on their own into the Valley of Mystery!

88073.name: GearHead
88073.description:
User Summary

The world's first Roguelike mecha role playing game.

Set on a ruined earth after a massive war that culminated in various superweapons being deployed disasterously while in space orvital colonies vie for supremacy. GearHead plays more like certain older tactical mecha games than it does a true Roguelike. Players can battle on foot, or more often in various vehicles and mecha. Gearhead comes in two modes. A standard ASCII Roguelike format, and a graphical sprite driven version.

You play a character from one of 5 different pasts ranging from refugee from the lunar colony war, to orphan, to anmesiac, to deserter from the army that attacked the lunar colony. There is a wide range of professions availible ranging from standard pilots to firefighters, to entertainers and more.

Once play begins the game selects several plot threads that the player may encounter along the way. It is very possible that no two games will play out quite the same depending on chance and choice.

The player can access a wide array of weapons and parts that can be purchased or more often salvaged from enemy vehicles and then attached to the players craft in many diffrent configurations. Personal equipment shares some of these features to allow the player to customize and upgrade weapons or even themselves with enhancements and cybernetics. This extends to NPCs the player may pick up along the way. Though how you act can have great impact on wether NPCs will stay on, or leave.

88074.name: Cabela's Dangerous Hunts 2009
88074.description:
Face the world's most dangerous animals, where a well-placed shot draws the line between life and death in this thrilling, non-stop hunting adventure!

25 of the World's Most Dangerous Animals - react quickly or get mauled by ferocious animals including Lions, Grizzly Bears, Cape Buffalo, Rhinos, Elephants, Jaguars, and more!

9 Exotic Locations around the Globe - travel the globe to places such as the Alaskan wilderness, the African savannah, the Russian tundra, and the South African jungle.

Non-Stop Danger - experience avalanches, stampedes, plane crashes, and piranha-infested waters.

Intense Melee Combat - failing to stop a ferocious animal charge will leave you in an intense struggle for your survival.

Challenging Boss Encounters - each level ends with a boss encounter, which will require skill and strategy to bring down the trophy.

Source: The Publisher Website.

88076.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Turtles in Time Re-Shelled
88076.description:
The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles are partnering with Ubisoft to celebrate their 25th Anniversary with a downloadable game inspired by one of the most acclaimed arcade games of all time – Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Turtles in Time. This 3D adaptation of the side scrolling, four-player action beat’em up based on the 1987 Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles animated series, features a variety of modes including online and local co-operative gameplay, single player mode, and a survival challenge putting to the test players’ ultimate ninja techniques.

RELIVE THE FUN IN A NEW HD SHELL
Relive, or discover for the first time, the flashy visual style and humor of one of the most acclaimed arcade games of all time starring everyone’s favorite pizza-loving, wise-cracking, reptilian crime fighters -- Leonardo, Donatello, Raphael and Michelangelo -- in beautiful full 3D HD graphics and enhanced animations and music.

SHARE THE FUN ONLINE
Not only can you oppose Shredder’s hordes on your own, you can also invite up to 3 of your friends at home or online to join your epic time travel adventure.

FIGHT CLASSIC TMNT CHARACTERS
Choose your favorite Ninja Turtle and fight a wide variety of classic TMNT villains -- from Shredder and his Foot Soldiers to Krang through Leatherhead -- each with unique moves, weapons and combat skills.

IT’S A SHELL OF A FIGHT
Packed with over-the-top fast pace ninja action and power-ups, “Turtles in Time Re-Shelled” offers hours of fun for everyone thanks to its easy pick-up and play controls, and its variety of stages ranging from Prehistoric times to a futuristic Star Base.

Source: The Developer's Website.

88077.description:
This is self-published expansion kit for Hideyoshi Gunki.
"Cho-Gen Ki" means "Record of Chōsokabe Motochika". Chōsokabe Motochika was Feudal lord in Japan and main person in this game.

Covering battles in Shikoku region by Chōsokabe Motochika.
Six scenarios are included in this kit.

Each players control one or more clans. The clan's combat units is organized to some troops.
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The action that can be selected is a movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

Victor of the games is the player who got more victory points. The victory point is provided by the holding of the castle and the removal of the enemy units.

Also need to play Standard rule (Late version), Reference card and some units from Hideyoshi Gunki.
88077.name: Cho-Gen Ki

88078.description:
This is self-published expansion kit for Kanto Seiatsu.
"Kanhasshu Kosenroku" means "Record of Ancient Battles in 8 States of Kanto Region".

Covering battles of Hojo clan before and after period of Kanto Seiatsu.
Six scenarios are included in this kit.

Also need to play Standard rule (Late version), Reference card and Map #2 from Kanto Seiatsu.
88078.name: Kanhasshu Kosenroku

88079.description:
From Osprey's publicity:

The Dark Age of Britain, from the middle of the 4th century to the end of the 8th, was a time of violence and warfare, when charismatic warlords such as the fabled King Arthur could gather together armies and carve out their own kingdoms. With this new set of wargames rules, players can take on the role of these warlords and command their own armies on the tabletop. Written by the author of the popular Glutter of Ravens rules set, Dux Bellorum is an element-based system, where each base of figures represents 50 fighting men. Each player has a specific number of points with which to construct his force and can choose to a Late Roman, Romano-British, Welsh, Saxon, Pictish, Irish, or Sea Raider army. The game is then played out following a set of simple, fast-paced rules. A completely self-contained gaming system, Dux Bellorum is perfect for gamers who are looking for a way into fighting Dark Age battles without investing a lot of time or money in larger rulesets.

From the playtest introduction:

Dux Bellorum is an Arthurian-era Dark Ages wargame, set in the period from the mid fourth century AD to the end of the eighth century AD. The rules emphasise the influence an army’s commander has on his units, with simple manoeuvre rules and chaotic, swirling close combat. You'll win by inspiring the right troops at the right time, balancing quality versus quantity in your army, and by finding a sprinkling of luck at the right time.

All distances are given in Base Widths, which allows the game to be used with any scale of miniature based in many different ways. An army usually has 6-12 units, and each unit is rated for Aggression (Attacks), Protection (Defence), and Cohesion (Strength) and is trained either as Shieldwall, Warriors, Riders, or Skirmishers (all of which operate differently in the game).

Dux Bellorum armies are selected from following lists: Late Roman, Romano-British, Welsh, Saxon, Pictish, Irish, Land Raider, Sea Raider.
88079.name: Dux Bellorum

boardgamefamily.22839: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

88080.name: Битвы Fantasy
88080.description:
In this fantasy miniatures game players each create an army with the same number of points (with each miniature having a different point value), then take turns moving and attacking until all of the opponent's forces are dead or captured. Players can use special magic and ability cards to provide advantage for their armies.
Unique game mechanic also allows players to launch small plastic missiles with heavy machines (such as ballista or catapult), physically knocking out enemy forces from the battle.

The universe of Fantasy Battles includes various epochs and genres, from fantasy cratures and gladiators to napoleonic wars and cossacks.

Usually each set includes 20 miniatures of characters or creatures, 4-6 warmachines, a deck of magic or ability cards 1 die and techsheets for each unit. Many sets also contain modular structures, such as walls or castle towers.

88081.name: Император 3
88081.description:
This fantasy-themed miniatures wargame is set on a hexagonal map with dimensions of 5X7 hexes with special 2 hexes marked as "castles". The goal of this game is to defeat all enemy forces or capture his "castle" hex.
Player may reinforce their armies by purchasing additional units during the game process. Also players may build walls and towers on hex borders to defend their castles.

This game is developed based on ideas from Император and Император 2 games.

Components:
32 warrior miniatures
10 plasic bases with flag and 3 slots for units
12 plastic towers
16 plastic walls
20 gold tokens
1 game map
1 rulebook
1 die

88082.name: Color Mio
88082.description: Color Mio is a Halli-Galli style speed card game about color mix matching instead of fruit counting. Players try to match one of two open palette card colors with combination of paint cards as fast as possible, opened by each player's turn. The correct player takes all open paint cards of every players and the matched palette card(s) is replaced with new one. After all palette cards are matched two times, the player with the most paint cards wins the game.

88083.description:
Jihad is a variant kit based on "Belisarius" published on S&T 224.
Original game, "Belisarius" was published in the Decision Games Strategy & Tactics magazine #210.

"Jihad !" is a wargame simulating the early expansion of Islam in the period of the Caliphs Omar and Othman (634-656 AD) when is 100 years after the parent game.

"Jihad !" is a two player game. The Caliphate player controls the forces of the Islam. The Kingdom player controls various non-caliphate kingdoms. Each player’s forces are represented by military units and Stratagem markers. Players must use a combination of military strength and cunning strategy to maintain and increase their power.

The rules are based on the Charlemagne (S&T #189) and Xenophon (S&T #203) games. And this system was later used in Khan (S&T #229).
88083.name: Jihad !

88084.name: Samurai Wars: juego de simulación estratégica en el Japón medieval
88084.description:
(From the Introduction)

"Samurai wars" is a game sited in medieval Japan. Each player represents a "Grand Lord", confronted with the other players for the control of lands and resources (mines, hamlets, castles...) in a combination of stretegy, planification, risk, diplomacy and (mostly) war.

In a game turn, each player must collect his resources in order to pay his army and, or recruit new units. after he can attack at his rivals, or ally with others, or be betrayed for his former allies. In this confussed scenario also are present the peasants, sometimes violent, sometimes powerless..., and the Ninjas, special units who can kill a "Grand Lord", removing it for the game.

The game units are completd with infantry, bowmen (each represents ten men), and the powerfull samurais.

At the end of the game (20 turns), the winner is the player with most resources controlled. If there is a tie, the game is played one more turn.

88085.name: Heavy Gear Arena
88085.description:
What is Arena? It's in your face! It's multi-ton robots trashing each other! It's all about drama on the field and off the field! This isn't your slow paced hack fest! This is Gears kicking tail and taking names!

Hire the best. Kit your Gears. Slug it out with the best. Only one team can rise to the top, but do you have what it takes to win?

Heavy Gear Arena is a fast paced, highly customizable tactical battle game set in the award winning Heavy Gear setting. For centuries, Terra Nova's best pilots have taken their Gears, advanced robotic fighting machines, and pitted them against each other in the world of sports dueling. Only the best stay in the games and earn their legendary reputations. Of course, reputations only get you so far. Winning equals money for upgrading your team and its equipment, the support of your adoring fans brings fame and more importantly the corporate sponsors, or just the thrills, pilots come from all over to find the thing they're desperate for in Khayr ad-Din.

Take on the role of team manager and build up your team to pit against the competition.

What you'll find in Heavy Gear Arena:

Robust tournament campaign rules
Duelists capable of growing in experience and talent
In depth Gear Customization
Support Personnel to aid your team's growth
Fast paced combat with combo chains and Duelist Talents

88086.description:
Clara's garden is game for 2-6 players. You need 1 set of nestortiles and 1 men for every player.

In Clara's garden is 60 flowers in ten colors. Flowers are in various class (1-6). Goal is pick most valuable flowers for bouquet where every flower will be in different color.

Components
- Nestortiles A-Type (60 tiles)
- One man for every player.

Setup
Before game players create random map of garden from nestortiles in grid 10x10.

Play
First move: All players in order put his man on tiles with value 1.

Next move: Player pick up tile and move his man diagonally, horizontally or vertically any number of squares. Only one man can be on square. Man can jumps over oposite men.

Game continue with next moves. Because empty fields cannot be crossed, isolated islands of tiles could be removed. Player can pick up more tiles with the color. But into final score will be counted only one most valuable flower for every color.
If player has no move, she picks up last tile and passes next moves.

End of game
Game is finished when one player has completed bouquet (she has tiles of all ten colors) or when all players are out of moves. Score is counted as sum of points of all flowers. If player has more flowers of the same color, only most valuable flower is counted. Player with best score is winner.

In Rule book there are Advanced rules too.
88086.name: Clara's garden

88088.name: Cranium: Disney Family Edition
88088.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Outrageous fun for the whole family!

Join Mickey and friends on a fun journey through the wonderful world of Disney! Celebrate everything Disney with friends and family as you. . .

CREATE works of art like Cinderella’s glass slipper;
PERFORM hilarious feats like finding something that Ariel would use to comb her hair; and
DISCOVER fun facts like "What does Hakuna Matata mean?"

Can you. . .

DRAW Pinocchio with your eyes closed?
SCULPT Phineas? or. . .
ACT out Captain Jack Sparrow?

Enjoy this playful game that delivers fun and laughter, and stretches the imagination every time!

Game includes: 16 Fun activities, 400 Disney-themed cards, 2 Mickey Mouse ears movers, game board, 1 tub of "Cranium Clay", 6 letter dice, Sand timer, 1 die, pad and pencil.

88089.name: Agatha Christie: Murder on the Orient Express

vgcharacterversion.338409: Hercule Poirot (Murder on the Orient Express)

88089.description:
From the instruction booklet:

"Climb aboard a luxurious train and become part of the famous murder mystery as you play the video game adaptation of Agatha Christie's Murder on the Orient Express. Famed game designer Lee Sheldon and AWE Games have teamed up once again to bring mystery adventure fans the second game in the Agatha Christie series.

Staying true to the novel, you will board a lavish, richly appointed train that departs Istanbul hurtling towards Paris. The train is filled with passengers, one of whom is the high profile Belgian detective Hercule Poirot. A passenger recognizes him, asks for protection, but is turned down. The next day that individual is found dead.

Take on the role of Antoinette Marceau, a new character, who works alongside Poirot to investigate the savage murder. On a train filled with suspects, Antoinette will need every tip that she can garner from Poirot in order to pinpoint the killer."

88090.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a honorable Samurai or a deadly Ninja. Grab a group or friends, blast, pound and bash them into mud on your way to victory. Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks. Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session. Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards. So, gear up and get ready for battle.
88090.name: Arena Assault: Samurai vs Ninja

88091.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a heavy hitting Athena or a versatile Purrtek. Grab a group or friends, blast, pound and bash them into kitty litter on your way to victory. Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks. Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session. Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards. So, gear up and get ready for battle.
88091.name: Arena Assault: Catfight

88092.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Battle as a powerhouse Crusher or a fusion blasting Robozon. Grab a group of friends, blast, pound and bash them into dust on your way to victory. Arena Assault is an expandable card game compatible with all other Arena Assault games and decks. Games are fast and furious, even with large groups, allowing for many battles to be played in one game session. Includes two 50 card decks, rules and 20 Arena Gear cards. So, gear up and get ready for battle.
88092.name: Arena Assault: Robot War

88093.name: Farscape: The Game
88093.description:
From the back of the box:

"All the excitement of the Hit TV Series ...and you're in the middle of it!

You are John Crichton, American Astronaut lost in space.

You are stranded on a hostile planet with an alien space babe.

You must find your crew, fight your enemies and get your ship back.

Interstellar Intrigue!

Heinous Crimes!

Cosmic Justice! "

Comments (gathered from various online sources): The game of the TV series, and with no introduction to the series universe, it's clearly designed for fans, with the original actors supplying the voices. Graphics and animation were not outstanding at the time, but were as good as most games of the type. The plater interface is typical of 3rd-person adventures, mostly clicking on locations, items or enemies with the mouse cursor to move, interact or fire.

The plot involves a Peacekeeper takeover of Moya, the Leviathan ship, leaving Crichton & Chiana stranded on the planet below, and D'Ago, Aeryn, Rygel & Zhaan imprisoned on Moya (Pilot, of course, is also aboard, being physically bonded to the ship). This is explained before the game starts, so no spoilers there. As this crew roster suggests, it takes place during Season 1.

The normal screen view is an overhead 3rd-person RPG/adventure view, with the player controlling up to 3 characters, one primary, and up to 2 'Sidekicks' who operate semi-autonomously. Which characters are controlled varies through the game.

Common criticisms of the game centre around the thin plot and short play time, and the rather basic controls.

88094.name: Dark Legacies Campaign Guide

rpghonor.14016: 2006 ENnie for Best Art, Interior - Runner Up

88094.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dark Legacies is a fresh new fantasy campaign setting and low-magic ruleset. Stylish and gritty, Dark Legacies gameplay is enhanced by the illustrations of industry-leading artists, including Adrian Smith and Ed Bourelle. In addition to a fully detailed world, Dark Legacies provides comprehensive rules oriented toward a mature and intense game experience, making it the definitive d20 low-magic setting.

Dark Legacies is set on Earth, thousands of years after an apocalypse sent the world spiraling into the eternal night of the Abyss. The intervening millennia have seen that world scoured by demons, populated by mysterious races of unknown origin, and eventually reclaimed by humanity as the Reversion pulled it out from its dark prison. The sun rises once again on an Earth that now lingers halfway between the mortal and demonic planes.

On this reborn Earth, unnatural creatures terrorize the wild lands, practitioners of demonic magic threaten the foundations of society, humans and nonhumans alike pile upon one another in polluted and overpopulated megacities, and adventurers explore ancient and afflicted territories, where they battle for coin, for knowledge, and for glory. And always, the people of the new Earth are wary of the demon threat lying beyond the horizon, where a perpetual storm front marks the entrance to the ever-waiting Abyss.

The Dark Legacies Campaign Guide is a dark fantasy d20 System sourcebook that provides expanded rules and complete setting information for Dark Legacies, including:

- Unique prestige classes tailored to low-magic gaming
- Advanced technology, including battlesuits and armored transports
- Rules for holy and demonic items of power
- The Abyss on Earth: a codex of demonic creatures and supplemental encounter guidelines
- Complete geography, history, and setting information for post-Reversion Earth

88095.description:
"It's War!! ...but in a nice way."

Good: the Battle is a miniatures based combat skirmish game, in which you take the role of a character or characters and attempt to defeat your opponents by doing good and inflicting bad upon them. The core game, designed by us at Project Good is the game of Good: the Battle. The uniqueness of Good: The Battle is it's ability to use any genre, any miniatures, anywhere, anything else...? Yes there is, but it's all Good...

Unlike the heavily stat-based games that you see everywhere nowadays, Good: the battle turns these statistics into two basic attributes; Good and bad. Obviously the better you are at things (shooting, close combat, healing, etc.) the longer you will survive in this world, but everyone has a limit of how much Good they can do. Nasty things like damage, curses, etc can only be described as Bad things, but sometimes a bit of bad is exactly what is needed.

There are thousands, probably hundreds of thousands, of character miniature manufacturers out there; and every single one of these can be used in Good: the Battle - regardless of scale, setting, period, race, etc. Good: the Battle uses the actual miniature to give you benefits in the game. For example; a miniature equipped with swords will be better in close combat, than somebody with none. A miniature carrying a rocket launcher will obviously do more damage if it shoots you in the head. Huge dragons will have more hit points, and mice will have less. But this doesn't mean a one-armed dwarf mute who's only weapon is a bag full of dead hamsters won't be able to put up a fight...
88095.name: Good: the Battle

88096.name: Airfix Dogfighter
88096.description:
From the back of the box:

"Bomb the garden, smash the crockery, slam the door on your enemy, turn out the lights - do anything in your power to destroy and survive.

Take the side of the Axis or Allies and bring your model plane to life in bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchens and more. With 17 authentic WWII planes to choose from and online warfare with up to 8 players, Airfix Dogfighter delivers the kind of fun mere plastic and glue could only dream! "

Aircraft depicted are (or were at the time of release) available from Airfix as 1:72 scale model kits, and are depicted more or less in scale with the house interiors in which the game takes place. In game controls and physics are decidedly arcade, as are weapon & repair pickups. In game modes are single-player campaign, online multiplayer, house designer, and paint room.

88097.name: Agents of Oblivion: Starfall Jungle (Savage Worlds)
88097.description:
plublisher blurb

Welcome to the Jungle! Starfall Jungle that is. A modern adventure of horror-espionage where players take on the roles of the covert Agents of Oblivion, a black ops organization battling terror and terrorism around the globe! Be ready to lock and load as you head way down south of the border on a mission that quickly descends into madness. Watch your six! Includes six characters good to go! . Looking for adventure? Remember Reality Blurs!

videogame.101826: Descent I and II: The Definitive Collection

88098.name: Descent II: The Vertigo Series

videogamecompilation.101826: Descent I and II: The Definitive Collection

88098.description:
An add-on for Descent II containing twenty additional levels (and three secret levels), two new multiplayer modes (Hoard and Team Hoard), plus the officially licensed Descent Mission Builder 2. It was lauded for its creative level design and the introduction of many exotic robots and two new bosses (briefing sessions had them in motion in contrast to static images in Descent II), though some levels also borrowed robots from Descent. "Flickering" lights were also a new feature to visual effects.

Source: Wikipedia, "Descent 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88099.name: Descent II: The Infinite Abyss
88099.description:
A 2-CD special release of Descent II. The first disc contains Descent II with the latest patch applied (providing support for 3dfx and Rendition video cards), while the second disc is the original "Vertigo Series" add-on (with remixed versions of original music tracks from the first CD in Redbook CD-audio format).

Source: Wikipedia, "Descent 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88100.name: Age of Empires Online

videogamehonor.31924: 2011 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

88100.description:
From Robot Entertainment's website:

With more than 20 million copies sold worldwide, the Age of Empires series redefined real-time strategy games for Windows PC players. Now the timeless franchise once again invites players to experience its rich storyline in new ways. Age of Empires Online will invite you to create a living, growing online world, shared with friends and friendly rivals around the globe.

Begin the journey with your own Greek civilization and watch as it progresses from a village to an empire. Embark on quests along the way, alone or with friends, and immerse yourself in epic tales, diverse characters, adventure, history and strategy. Together with the Games for Windows – LIVE service, Age of Empires Online delivers a rich, social experience that lets you play however you want – anywhere, anytime.

Marrying fresh features with iconic gameplay, Age of Empires Online offers something for long-time fans, newcomers, and everyone in between.

Age of Empires Online will feature:

A persistent online capital city that lives and grows even when you’re offline
Cooperative multiplayer quests, trading, and a level-based system that lets you progress at your own pace
Fun, approachable style and storylines
Free to play experiences via Games for Windows – LIVE

88101.name: The Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings

videogamehonor.31896: 2010 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee

88101.description:
User Summary:

Assasins of Kings is the follow-up title to 2007's The Witcher. It shares the same universe, as features in the Witcher novels by Andrzej Sapkowski, and heroes as it's predecessor, including Geralt, Dandellion, Triss and Zoltan.

The game has been made available for pre-order in November 2010, and is available in a digital copy on Steam as well as the CD Project ran GOG.com. There is also a collector's edition including many bonus items.

88102.name: Overclocked: A History of Violence
88102.description:
Overclocked: A History of Violence is a psychological thriller adventure game developed by House of Tales and published by Lighthouse Interactive. The game was released on April 21, 2008 for retail and direct download.

The game, thematically about the effect and aftermath of violent acts, is about US Army psychiatrist David McNamara who is treating several mentally-scarred teen patients, during a violent thunderstorm in New York City.

Source: Wikipedia, "Overclocked: A History of Violence," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88103.name: Gunman Chronicles
88103.description:
Gunman Chronicles is a futuristic first-person shooter video game originally created as a mod by the now defunct Rewolf Software. Gunman Chronicles was originally a Quake deathmatch mod named Gunmanship 101, then it was moved to Quake II's engine before becoming a Half-Life mod. At the Half-Life Mod Expo in 1999, Gunman Chronicles stole the show and Sierra approached Rewolf to make a retail version. After significant work, Rewolf was given some office space, funding and a mapper (Jeff Lane) by Valve Software to help complete the project. It was released as a standalone game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gunman Chronicles," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88104.name: Pirate Dice and Bag
88104.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Endless sea, islands and ships. Untold adventure, storms and sea battles with the flag on the mast. Time to tighten that eyepatch and put the Treasures in the Bag! We present these two wonderfuly detailed Pirate dice, with pieces of a map on each of the faces. And on the highest face - a Pirate flag! And in this set You also receive a linen bag for all your treasures!

88105.name: Doomsday - Y
88105.description:
From the back cover

The women of W.O.M.A.N. are tired of the oppression of our male-dominated society.

The catch?

They can do something about it- and they will!

Pulsator has gathered together a like-minded group of women who are ready to change the world for the better - or at least, how they think the world should be if it were going to get better. After all, if mean are the problems, the answer is simple if you take it logically...

Witness the horror of Atoman's transformation!

Fume as W.O.M.A.N. frustrates you ate very turn!

Swear vengeance and bring them to justice -
provided you don't have a change of heart.

Doomsday Minus Y is a module designed to be played with the Femforce or your own characters, with a wide variety of level possibilities. From low level lassies to high power heroines, Doomsday Minus Y can handle them all. Come one, come all... if you dare!

88107.name: Mystery Gun
88107.description:
This game features a circular metal lithographed playing board, which is very similar to a metal tray. The board has a "gun" at the bottom which shoots metal balls at metal airplanes which are placed at the 4 predetermined positions near the top half of the board. A pullstring is wrapped around the spinner and then it is pulled like a top. The metal balls are then loaded into the left side of the "gun" and the spinning mechanism "fires" the balls out the other side of the gun in rapid fire. The metal airplanes have a ball-bearing on the underside of the planes that allows them to rest in the holes near the top of the board. When a fired shot hits the airplane it is dislodged from its position and it falls toward the bottom of the playing area, thus crashing into the ground. The player then scores points based on which airplanes are shot down. Each player gets a set number of "shots" and the player with the most points after all players have taken their shots wins the game.
This game is made by McDowell Mfg. and was manufactured around the 1930's.

88108.name: GRIP: Basic Edition
88108.description:
Publisher Blurb:

GRIP (Generic Role-playing for Internet Players) is a set of personal gaming software that brings you all of the basic tools required to conduct a typical face-to-face role-playing session, and combines them with the power of networking to let you literally play any role-playing game with anyone, anywhere in the world.

With the Internet, or a Local Area Network acting as an electronic version of a table, GRIP provides the electronic versions of the pencils, paper, character sheets, maps, dice, and other tools required for a good role-playing session. Communication between the Game Master and players is conducted via a text-based chat system, private whisper messages, and optional Voice Chat support with Roger Wilco.

Online role-playing, while not meant to replace traditional face-to-face gaming, actually offers a few benefits that are hard to match in a traditional setting. GRIP allows you to take full advantage of the multimedia capability of computers by incorporating images, sounds, and any other type of media or file into your adventures. These can then been sent as need to players during the course of the game, automatically opening and activating on the player's computer.

GRIP's private Whisper messages sent between players and the Game Master avoid the awkward note passing and distracting whispers that can accompany face-to-face games. Such messages are passed silently and are only seen by the intended recipient, unknown to the other players (although the Game Master, of course, sees all whispers!). Game Masters can even request secret, mandatory dice rolls from players, perfect for saving throws, and other nefarious purposes!

This Basic Boxed Edition includes:

-56 page User's Manual
-32 page Character Sheet Design Tutorial
-Character Sheet Markup Language Quik-Reference Card
-GRIP iGM (Game Master) Module
-GRIP iPC (Player) Module
-Grimshot's Gauntlet Fantasy Adventure for use with GRIP
-A Simple Twist of Fate Science Fiction Adventure for use with GRIP

88109.name: GameMastery Map Pack: Shops
88109.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Open for Adventure!

Bargain hunters beware, dragon-sized discounts are ready to rampage through your campaign! As much as adventurers enjoy delving through dungeons and slaying monsters, there’s something else treasure-hunters love: shopping for new gear. Whether your heroes are preparing for their next adventure or are back from the dungeon with backpacks bursting with loot, no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every tavern stool or store shelf. Fortunately, with Paizo Publishing’s latest GameMastery Map Pack, you don’t have to!

This line of gaming accessories provides simple and elegant tools for the busy Game Master. Inside, you’ll find 18 captivating 5" × 8" specially coated map tiles, allowing you to use wet-erase and dry-erase markers, then remove ink with ease!

The tiles herein can be combined into a variety of any town’s most adventurer-friendly shops and establishments or reveal the interior of locales appearing on GameMastery Flip-Mat: City Streets, including:

Armorsmith
Weapon Dealer
Curiosity Shoppe
Scriptorium Bookseller
General Store
Local Tavern

Game Masters shouldn’t waste their time sketching maps every time their players need to pick up supplies. With GameMastery Map Pack: Shops, you’ll always be ready whether your players head to market hunting for bargains or adventure!

88110.name: Stir 'em Up! The Flipping & Switching Word Game
88110.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is no ordinary crossword game...it's unpredictable, it's fast-paced, it's Stir 'em Up! Scoop the letters out of the bowl, but don't get attached - the die may force you to flip them or switch them. And once it's time for everyone to make their own crosswords, don't dawdle - you've got 30 seconds to use more letters than everyone else!

User Summary

Once everyone has their letters, roll the die to stir things up! If the die shows a color, everyone must flip over those color tiles they have. If it lands on "right," they take two tiles from the person to their right. If it lands on "left," they pass two tiles to the person to their left. Now ask them to
try to form a word with the tiles. The word must have at least three letters (no
one- or two-letter words). The person to announce a word gets the points for that word. Continue playing until all tiles have been used or you run out of room on the board.

88111.name: D6 Magic
88111.description:
From the PDF's Introduction:

Vade Mecum of Magic makes the perfect companion to the magic system presented in the D6 Adventure Rulebook or the D6 Fantasy Rulebook. We give you explanations, clarifications, additonal guidelines, and more than XX new spells.So, if you just haven't had the chance to pick up the D6 Adventure Rulebook or D6 Fantasy Rulebook, can you still get something out of this book? Absolutely! We've included a couple of new, simple magic systems that're compatible with the full-blown version. We also give you information about the skills, so you can use the spells right out of this book.Need more spells? Check out the D6 Bloodshadows world-book! In it, you'll find more than 60 spells, plus an extended spell failure chart, potions and other magical items, and new horror-inspired species packages. If you feel like trying your hand at making spells but don't want to number crunch, West End Games offers a basic spell designer on its Web site (www.westendgames.com/d6/makespell.html). Use it a few times to help you understand how the full magic system works.


NOTE: D6 Magic/D6 Vade Mecum of Magic (WEG 51024) was never released as a completed product. This Open D6 release was made from the last draft completed, therefore, use of material should be considered as is.

88113.description:
Isaac is an abstract strategy game for two players.

The game is divided in two different phases, placement and scoring.

During the placement, a player places one of his rectangular pieces on the available spaces of a 10×10 square grid board.

During the scoring, each player removes one of his pieces from the board, scoring a number of points equal to the number written on the removed piece times the number of pieces that lie on the row/column from which the piece was removed. A piece can be removed only if it is at least long as the longest piece already removed by the same player.

Each player uses his/her own counter to keep track of his/her points but the counter itself is placed on the board (that is, the board is also the score track). The presence of a counter on the row/column from which a piece is taken doubles the points scored. A player can decide to score less points than he/she earned, therefore allowing to place the score counter in a more convenient place.

You can play Foundations and Hari with an Isaac set.

Source: Author's description

Online Play


http://www.iggamecenter.com/ - igGameCenter (real-time)


Awards:

Winner of the NESTORGAMES continuous abstract game design contest
Winner of the Abstract Game Design Contest at the Caldè "Tutto è numero" Mathematical Festival 2011
88113.name: Isaac

88114.name: Coin Push Frenzy
88114.description:
User Summary

Coin Push Frenzy is a coin drop game for the iOS. The goal of the game is to drop coins in strategic locations, in order to push other coins of a table. You get free coins every 30 secons, but you can buy them as an inapp purchase. In the game, you can also get powerups to make the game more easy.

88115.name: Pig Rush
88115.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Users want casual games that they can pick up and play. ReignDesign developed Pig Rush, a hilarious addictive platform game for iPhone.

Help Jumpy the Pig on his first fun adventure running away from the farm! On the way he encounters deep ravines, forest fires and moving platforms. The longer you survive, the faster Jumpy runs - and the more difficult the obstacles become! Developed in Unity, the quirky 3D-style graphics have won widespread acclaim.

88116.name: Gravitation Defense
88116.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Gravitation Defense is an original, simple, fun and intense pick-up and play action game. The objective is to survive for as long as possible by pushing back the threats with your fingers while waves of increasingly difficulty attack the Earth.

The gameplay can be seen as a sort of cross between missile command, asteroid and flight control, as the player manages the traffic around the earth.

The controls are being done with the fingers over the whole screen. In the impact mode of gameplay, the fingers can 'bump' away the incoming threats in the direction of the finger movement.
In the gravitation mode of gameplay, the fingers act as gravity emitters when they touch the screen. Every action will cost energy. It is not possible to deflect incoming threat without energy so it must be managed carefully. Rhythm is the key!

Points are made by kicking asteroids out of Earth gravitation field or destroying the threats. A sequence of points without being hit will increase the points multiplier, thus leading to a better score.

Features:

- 4 modes of gameplay
-> Challenge Mode with 40 challenges
-> Survival, impact mode
-> Survival, gravitation mode
-> Hardcore survival, impact mode
- Over 30 unique levels organized in a system of random level branching and events to make sure that each game played is different.
- Over 16 types of threat; various asteroids of different behaviour, missiles, comets, flying saucer, etc.
- Over 8 different types of rewards; health boost, energy boost, multiplier boost, bonus points, escape pods which must be protected, etc.
- Openfeint achievements and worldwide leaderboard.
- Great and immersive soundtrack.
- Includes a save game system so the game can be resumed later if interrupted.
- Realistic gravitation physics motion.
- More content to come in future updates!
- Includes a save game system so you can resume later if you get interrupted.

88117.name: StarDunk
88117.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

StarDunk is a futuristic game combining the best of basketball, massive online competition and retro games.

- Simple and addictive gameplay
- Massive online competition against all the players from the planet
- Powerful bonuses to increase your score
- Earn awards and unlock more than 15 unique balls, each with its unique capacities
- 60 FPS on 3GS and iPod 3rd gen with enhanced graphics and next-gen shaders.
- Add your friends to Plus+ and play against them online
- Race to the top of global leaderboards for high scores glory

88118.name: A Ninja Dude: Ninja School
88118.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Welcome to Ninja Dude Ninja School.
Founded in 2010, the Ninja Dude School of Ninja is a center for education at the undergraduate and graduate levels. The school has the world best professor of ninjastar, sword and magic words field, and there are a lot of the best assassins who graduate Ninja Dude School of Ninja. Our goal is that make students the best ninja of the world. If you want to be the greatest ninja or assassin, just join us. Be a super duper ninja with us!!

Courses

The School of Ninja offers courses primarily for undergraduate students now.
Freshman has to pass four type weapons tests(Midterm, Final exam).
We strongly recommend preparation in newbie survival mode before take exam.
After pass the final exam, expert survival mode will be available.

88119.name: Bush Wacker
88119.description:
User Summary

Bush Whacker is a game in which you walk around the countryside whacking bushes with your trusty words, collecting puzzlepieces to capture monsters, collect treasure and other fun activities.
Collect hats, capes, critters, customize your house, and explore the wide open world of Bush Whacker!

88121.name: Cascade
88121.description: A tower is filled with 5 columns of coloured balls. Each player can on their turn take as many balls of the same colour from the bottom of the columns as they want. The winner is the player who has taken the most balls at the end of the game.

88122.name: Thumb Wars
88122.description:
User Summary

The classic game of thumb wars has been translated to the iPhone by appsNminded. In this version of the game, you try to pin your opponents thumb for four seconds, then you've won the game.

You can either play the iPhone or your friends.

88123.name: Finger Physics: Thumb Wars
88123.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

One, Two, Three, Four, I Declare a Thumb War! The extension to the #1 Puzzler is here!

Finger Physics Thumb Wars is a finger-bending-mind-teasing puzzler just like its predecessor but with a completely different strategy. The objective is to collect as many stars as possible using shapes, tools, spinners, levers, hinges, glass and more!

88124.name: Cubed Rally Racer
88124.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Cubed Rally Racer is an 3d isometric rally car racing game where each level is randomly generated. Race around the track collecting gas/boost cans trying to get the best time. Think Dirt meets RC Pro-Am meets Canabalt.

Game Features:
* Over 40 different types of sections!
* Thousands of track combinations!
* Challenge friends to beat your time on any level using OpenFeint's challenge system.
* 8bit style 3d graphics.
* Configurable controls.
* Track elements such as: Curves, Jumps, Whoops, Walls, Ships, Gophers and Cows!
* Randomly generated levels!
* Facebook and Twitter integration!
* Unlock up to 99 sections!
* OpenFeint Leaderboard and Achievements!
* Ghost car shows the best time!
* and MORE!

88125.name: Mr. AahH!!
88125.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

A game which gives you great thrills and exhilaration
is now available on "iPhone/iPod touch"!
It's called..."Mr. AahH!!"

With a very simple control, enjoy this action game
which gives you outstanding exhilaration.

Tap in a timely manner and land on the next cliff!!
Be careful not to shout out too loud when you fail to land.
Now, let's let out your "AAaahhHH!!!"

88126.name: Time's Up! Family
88126.description:
Time's Up! Family is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players (and is best with teams of two). Before the game begins, each player looks at several cards featuring well-known items, crafts and animals and chooses some of them. Each player's cards and shuffled to form a deck, and this deck is used for each of the game's three rounds.

In each round, team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many words and phrases on the cards as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed, and the cluegiver cannot pass on a card. In round 2, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted); the cluegiver can pass on any card he likes, and the teammates can give only a single answer. In round 3, the cluegiver can use no words at all and can pass as often as he likes; again, teammates are allowed only a single guess. Give good physical clues in round 1, and they'll pay dividends down the road when you need to keep your mouth shut and gesture like a maniac before time's up!

88127.name: Bowl' Em  Over
88127.description:
Set up the 12 bowling pins and aim to get a strike. This game is fun for everyone and will unleash your competitive side!

Object of the game is to knock all the bowling pins down and score a strike.


Comes with: 1 Bowling Alley, 12 Bowling Pins, 2 side supports
1 Score Sheets
1 Instruction Sheet
2 Bowling Balls
1 Monkey Bowler

88128.name: The Zoo Break Game
88128.description:
From the front cover: The animals are escaping. Capture the most to win and become head zoo keeper.

User summary: A roll-and-move game where the players are zookeepers trying to catch all of the animals that have escaped from the zoo. Based on the roll of a die in the game's unique elephant dice tower, a player will either move his pawn the indicated number of spaces, attempting to land on and capture an animal, or follow the instructions on an event card. When all of the animals have been captured, the player with the most animals wins.

88129.name: Gulf War
88129.description:
Excerpt from page 3 of the rules: Gulf War involves the use of military maneuvers and the careful use and selection of weapons, in order to achieve sea, ground and air supremacy. Gulf War is made up of two teams, regardless of the number of players.

Excerpt from page 1 of the rules:
Long Version (Game One): The object of game 1 is to completely destroy and eliminate your enemy from the game board by using your various weapons.
Short Version (Game Two): The object of game 2 is to maneuver your flag on the game board, as well as protect it by using your various weapons. In addition, weapons must eliminate your opponent's flag to achieve victory.

From the front of the box:
Dedicated to all those who helped liberate Kuwait!

88130.name: Spotcha!
88130.description:
The Wild, Which-Way-Did-They-Land Game

Spotcha! takes fast eyes and faster hands. Start by tossing the 18 oddball objects and watch how they land. Flip a card and the race is on. Is the lawn mower rightside-up? Is the ghost face down? Look, the wizard hat is on its side! Quick, grab the correct scoring flags before anyone else. Everybody plays on every turn, so it's all-out, mad-cap fun for everyone!

88134.name: Bangkok 1984
88134.description:
From the PDF:

Bangkok, Thailand. In 1984 it’s East vs. West; man vs. man as two separate battles are waged. In the shadows Western and Eastern spies vie for control of information -- documents, telemetry, moles, anything and everything that could tip the scales past their delicate balancing point and lead to hegemony.

Under the harsh glare of television cameras and reporter scrutiny, the two sides fight a second proxy war at the Chess World Championships. The stress is palpable and it won’t be long before somebody cracks.

Add to that the exotic, freewheeling, anything goes, and usually has a price, atmosphere of Bangkok and the situation is ripe for a fiasco.

88135.name: Fortune's Fool
88135.description:
From the publisher:

Fortune’s Fool is a bold new role-playing game that uses the Tarot deck instead of dice! Set in a fantastic version of Renaissance Europe, Fortune’s Fool invites you to play a character from a wide array of races and backgrounds. Humans, elves, goblins, and more cross swords and cast spells in the courts of Paris and along the canals of Venice.

One week you might find yourself fighting monsters in the icy peaks of the Swiss Alps. The next you might be kidnapping Shakespeare from a rehearsal of King Lear! Whatever your adventures, success or failure is determined by the cards of the Fate Deck.

Will your next card be Strength, giving you a devastating blow, or will The Hanged Man spoil your attack? Perhaps The Tower will menace the table, or maybe The Fool will turn everything on its head. And somewhere in the deck lurks Death itself, waiting to claim its next victim.

So set down your dice and pick up the Tarot deck and give Fortune’s Fool a try!

Fortune’s Fool: your fate is in the cards.

88136.name: Texel Info Toerspel
88136.description:
"An informative route game around the island of Texel"

This is a roll-and-move game published to promote tourism on the Dutch island of Texel. The players throw the die to move their pawn across 87 spaces on a map of the island; the first player to reach the finish, wins.

88137.name: Shamus: Case II
88137.description:
User Summary

This sequel to Shamus was a cross between Adventure and Berserk (and a whole lot more..) You maneuvered your futuristic detective through a maze consisting of a series of rooms, each with enemies to overcome through cleverness/firepower. A test of reflexes designed by Synapse for the Atari and Commodore 8-bit systems.

Programmed by William Mataga.

88138.name: Agatha Christie: Evil Under the Sun
88138.description:
From the ReadMe file:

"September, 1940. War has engulfed Europe and the Battle of Britain rages, defining England’s finest hour. Hercule Poirot is sequestered at his desk behind blackout curtains at the immaculate Whitehaven Mansions. Arthur Hastings sits nearby, riveted by Poirot’s account of an island summer vacation turned deadly. Shortly after Poirot arrived at the Smuggler’s Rest Hotel, a resident was savagely murdered. Poirot solved the mystery in a single day; and now he wonders if his friend Hastings would have been equal to the task. Eager to prove himself, Hastings allows Poirot to take him back in time - to recount all the events he experienced and see if Hastings can arrive at the same insightful conclusions as Poirot himself. Play as Hastings (who is in turn playing as Poirot!) as you relive the tragic confluence of people, circumstances, dark histories, and motives culminating in the primal crime. As the seemingly omniscient Poirot ominously intoned the day before the murder, 'The sun shines...the sea is blue...but there is evil everywhere under the sun.'"

rpgitemversion.75667: The Immortal Avenger, Premiere Issue, comic book

88139.name: 13: Assassin Comics Module #1
88139.description:
From the Back Cover:

In this Issue:
"The Awakening Storm"
By Mike W. Barr, Robb Phipps and Alfredo Alcala. After Decades of imprisonment by the evil Brotherhood, Agent 13 breaks free. With renewed vengeance he is deadlier than ever. He's 13: Assassin!

Also in this issue:
"The Final Weapon" by Scott Haring, Frank Springer and Larry Mahlstedt.

Plus: The first set of Agent 13 collector game cards. 24 cards in full color with two exciting games to play. In addition, game stats for major characters for use with the Top Secret/S.I. game and Agent 13 sourcebook!


From the Inside Cover:

13:Assassin and Final Weapon features the 1990s adventures of TSR's mystical spy, Agent 13. The leader of an ancient society was literally ripped apart by 13 in 1939 and his head has been stored in a box ever since. Now he's back with a vengeance. In Final Weapon, we begin the destruction of the spy organizations WEB and ORION. The 13:Assassin Collector Game Cards debut in this issue, and will expand in future issues.

88140.description:
This is a strategic marble stomping game.
Outwit your opponents by stomping their marbles before they stomp yours!
Outmaneuver by leaving their "stomper" trapped with no escape. OUTSTOMP the competition and you win!
Each player has a "stomper" piece with a marble of a different color attached to the top. On a player's turn, he or she may stomp any marble (by putting it on top of it, knocking it underneath the board), not in the outside ring. On the following turn, the player can stomp any adjacent marbles of the same color, or stomp a marble matching the color of his/her "stomper" piece.
88140.name: Stomple

88141.name: The Bull
88141.description:
From the blurb:

The Bull was an entry in the Fiasco Playset Contest 2010. And it ended up winning first prize.


The Bull is your typical Stockport boozer. The sun doesn't shine a whole lot in Stockport. There sure is a lot of rain though. The locals that sup a pint of a night in The Bull have lives like rainy days. They take their sunshine as and when they can. Which isn't all that often.


The playset takes inspiration from British telly shows such as Early Doors and Shameless.

88142.name: Black Eagles
88142.description:
Toussaint L’Ouverture and the slave insurrections in Saint-Domingue (now Haiti), the richest trading colony in the new world, shocked and terrified Western Nations. Not since Spartacus had slave rebellions succeeded on such a grand scale. However, this story cannot be confined to a single leader like Toussaint. It is far more complicated, riddled with intrigue and rife with defections. There is no shortage of villains, and heroes are often conflicted. On the surface, the topic is obscure but the ramifications for this conflict were incredibly far-reaching.

Black Eagles is a card assisted, multi-player, area movement cube game that covers the period 1792-1804. Black Eagles is broken into four distinct scenarios: the "Rights of Man," or the introduction of republican ideals to the island; "Imperial Designs," or the invasion of English and Spanish forces; "Civil War," internal conflict between the Mulattos and the rebel leaders; and finally "Leclerc Invades," featuring Napoleon's attempt to restore slavery to the island.

Black Eagles allows one (yes, there is a solitaire version) to four players to command one of five historical rebel leaders, Toussaint L'Ouverture included, as well as Napoleon's veteran general Charles Victoire Emmanuel Leclerc. Those not commanded by players become factions available for alliance, along with the Gros Blancs, the Petits Blancs, the Spanish, the French, and the English, each provides the controlling player with a special ability. Alliances are fluid, as is the allegiance of the very units under your command. The more of the island's economy a player controls the more havoc he can cause with the funds he collects. On the other hand, the player who carries the least influence automatically controls the Petits Blancs and no matter how weak a player is, he can always attack a stronger player's economic base.

Black Eagles is no longer in its infancy. Play testing has proven it to be well worthwhile. Scenario play ranges from 90 minutes to four hours. Components include a 22" by 34" map, 45 card events that affect play in various turn phases --cards also provide resolution for the devastating Yellow Fever. THe game will include Player aids, hundreds of 6mm colored cubes (factional combat units), and several sheets of miscellaneous markers.

88144.name: The Fall Harvest
88144.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Polk County Annual Fall Festival is the highlight of the season what with all the rides, games, contests, music, apple- and pumpkin-filled treats drawing in folks from up to three hours away. But this year something else in attendance, something evil, something hungry. Grown-ups needn't worry though, the being in question only harvests the youngest of crops!

"The Fall Harvest" is the second in the CAMPFIRE TALES series of monthly standalone episodes for use with Little Fears Nightmare Edition.

88145.name: Combat Command: World War II Skirmish Rules for 25mm Miniatures
88145.description:
Combat Command is a fully playable set of rules that allow you to fight larger skirmish actions of World War II in four hours or less!

Only 18 pages of core rules, all writen in an easy to read style, backed up by over 140 pages of table of organization and equipment data - including airplanes - for all major nationalities!

Scale: one figure equal one man, one weapon, or one vehicle.

88147.description:
You are the heir to the throne, but the monarch might live a very long time. You intend to speed things along, but it will only work if the major personalities in the kingdom back your play. You need to buy, trick, or eliminate anyone who might stand in your way.

In this solitaire Decktet game, personality cards represent different people in the kingdom who you need to control; personalities are the cards done up like face cards, with two close ups of a single figure. All of the other cards represent elements which you can use to control personalities. Your goal is to "influence" every personality card in the deck by paying one or more cards from your resource row that each share at least one suit with the targeted personality and have a combined value of at least the personality cards value.

If you influence all the personalities in the deck than you win! Miss even one though, or end up with no available moves, and its the headsman's block for you.
88147.name: Adaman

88148.name: Gomo Guide to Thoneport
88148.description:
Supplement for the human realm of Thantier, and the only port in Thantier where non-humans can be at ease. Thoneport is a section of the capital of Thantis where trade opportunities and adventure come together. Return to Jorune, the planet of the Skyrealms.

Source: lulu.com, "Gomo Guide to Thoneport" listing.

88149.name: Brawurowy Wolsung
88149.description:
The official coversion of Wolsung rules to Savage Worlds.

Publisher Blurb:

Konwersja obejmuje:

zasady pozwalające stworzyć bohatera wywodzącego się z jednej z ośmiu rozumnych ras;
nowe przewagi rasowe, społeczne i magiczne;
zasady konfrontacji społecznych;
specyficzne dla świata Wolsunga zasady magii i opisy pięciu zdolności nadprzyrodzonych;
przykładowych przeciwników.




User Translation from Polish:

This conversion includes:

rules for character creation born among the eight intelligent races
new traits: racial, social and magical
rules for social conflicts
Wolsung-specific rules for magic and description of five supernatural skills
examples of opponents

88150.name: Pinocchio, Wood Golem Gone Wild
88150.description:
From the publisher:

The introductory adventure for Fortune's Fool turns a classic tale on its head! The PCs careen across Italy in a desperate search for the wooden boy, but it will take more than a cricket and a conscience to put a happy ending on this story!

This black-and-white 23-page PDF is geared for GMs and players new to Fortune's Fool but can be readily enjoyed by experienced players. It comes with 5 pregen characters and is ready to play!

88151.name: Protodimension (Issue 6 - Fall 2010)
88151.description:
Table of Contents:

From The Shadows
By Tad Kelson

Sarah’s Friends
An Adventure
By Phil Bignall
For Call of Cthulhu®

Chirp, Chirp
Fiction
By Tim Bisaillon

Incident 429
Space Beasties, Sort Of...
By Norm Fenlason
For Dark Conspiracy®

Dream Job
Fiction Plus
By Dave Schuey

Words with the Psychedelic Goblin
Interview with Colin Chapman
By Tad Kelson

Table for Two
Dinner Table Humor
By The Braincase Factory

Film at 11
Fiction
By Jeff Moeller

Heroes of Faith
Faithful Settings
By Randy Alan Donahue
For Dark Conspiracy®

Industrial Still Life in Winter
Chilling Fiction
By Jason C. Hosler

My Hell
Poetry
By Peyton Bisaillon

The Truth about Mr. Taylor
Cul-de-sac Adventure
By Norm Fenlason
For Little Fears: Nightmare Edition®

Special Forces Hooker
Armalite MH-12 MagHook
By Lee Williams
For Dark Conspiracy®

88152.name: Fun and Gnan: 2 in 1 Game Pack
88152.description:
This is a game from India published for the purpose of educating children in the teachings of the guru Gnani Purush Shri Ambalal Muljibhai Patel, also known as Dada Bhagwan. It consists of two separate boardgames: "Dada's World", which teaches about how to behave apropriately in given situations and answer questions about the guru's teachings; and "Guess, Who Am I?", which focuses on identifying role models.

Game 1 (Dada's World) - Players roll a die and move along a track which represents their journey through Dada's World, collecting rectangular plastic "coins" with a variety of point values.
Landing on marked spaces along the track can either add points (Helped Poor Person: 100), subtract points (Killed a cockroach: -150), provide the opportunity to answer questions about Dada's teachings to earn points (Dadai Dhamaka), lose turns, take extra turns, go back to Home, and other similar effects. At certain points on the track, players have the opportunity to pay points to take a shorter route.
The winner is the first player to make a complete circuit of the track and return to the start space with 1500 points or more. Players who complete the track with fewer than 1500 points must go back to an earlier square and try to accumulate more points.

Game 2 (Guess, Who Am I?) - Players roll a die and move along a track collecting pieces of three separate puzzles. Most of the spaces on the board are marked with a statement associated with one of the three "role models" - Parents, Dadashri and Humanity. When landing on a space on the board, players must identify which role model is associated with the statement on that space (example: Space #17 "We should bow down to them every day" is associated with Parents). Correctly identifying the role model allows the player to take the puzzle piece associated with that space.
Other spaces give the player a free random puzzle piece, allow the player to take a piece from another player, or cause the player to lose a turn. Players who reach the end of the track without winning the game move back to Start and continue to collect puzzle pieces.
To win, a player must collect all 12 pieces of one of the three puzzles. He may then assemble the puzzle to see a picture representing one of the role models, then flip the pieces over to reveal a message.

From the rule booklet:

Hello kids!!!

Time to enter DADA'S WORLD filled with excitement, fun & learn.....

This 2-in-1 Game Pack offer dual knowledge and fun, Get the tracks right from 'Home' to 'Simandhar City' and back 'Home' in Game 1. If you follow the rule you are IN, if you refrain then you commit a SIN.

Also recognize the ROLE MODELS of your life by learning their virtues and identifying them in Game 2. Abount Parents, Dadashri and humanity is what we get to learn.

Wow! So much to do, so much to learn, so little time we want more fun, then grab on this Game Pack 2-in-1.

88153.name: Raliul OLTCIT
88153.description:
From the original rules:
"OLTCIT Rally (Raliul OLCIT) is an attractive competition game created in order to learn the road signs along with their meaning, racing elements and specific terminology."

The game board is made from 65 modular plastic tiles, 43 having numbers on them.

After choosing the favorite color of your car, when your turn comes, you role one die and move on the board with a number of spaces equal with the number depicted on it. After this, you search the space number in the game rules to see what you have to do:pay taxes,receive points, low speed, high speed, going forward, going backwards, or do nothing (if the tile you are sitting on is blank).

In this way you can earn or lose points. The player with the highest score wins.

88154.name: My Supernatural Romance
88154.description:
Author Summary:

Long story short: somehow, she went out with him and maybe even married him anyway, and now he's trying to find a role-playing game they can play together. And My Supernatural Romance could be it!
My #1 design goal with this game was to make a game I could play with my non-gamer wife, inspired by Emily Care Boss's Breaking the Ice and Ron Edwards's S/Lay w/Me. We wanted the romance from Breaking the Ice, the adventure and conflict and oracles from S/Lay w/Me, and we wanted the subject matter to be something we both were into. I'm not into contemporary romances; she's not into pulp fantasy - but add vampires to your romance and it's something we both can enjoy.
So this is a game that is mainly intended to create stories in the vein of Twilight and True Blood and The Little Mermaid – the protagonists fall in love with something that's outside their own species, and trouble ensues, but if you want you can easily take the mermaids, vampires, or ghosts out and tell a more standard romance novel story – not so much the “bodice ripper” sort of romance, but the romance of the formula: girl meets boy; boy is kind of an asshole; they dance around each other for a while; turns out the boy had a reason for being an asshole and they get together. Pride and Prejudice made the mold and thousands of stories have been fabricated therein.
You may think "I hate romance, this isn't for me", but wait - almost every movie has a love subplot, even if it's not the main plot, and some movies, like Wall-E and Spider-Man 2, the love story is the main plot and saving the world is actually the sub-plot! Even Fight Club: meeting Marla Singer is what drives the book and the movie, is what turns Edward Norton to Brad Pitt. So there - maybe you like romance more than you think. And yet love is very under-represented in games - even story games and RPGs - and for good reason. For one thing, love stories and ensemble casts don't go together - for a love story to work in a game, you probably only want 2 players. So – if it's a game you're playing with just your significant other – game on!"

User Summary:

Published as a wiki page - so no actual page #s.

88155.name: Telegruv
88155.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Telegruv is the new party game that takes the classic game, Telephone, to the next level. Draw cards illustrating popular dance moves including: The Twist, The Snake, and Brush Your Shoulders Off. Perform these moves for your teammates and get ready to laugh as your team tries to keep your dance sequence intact all the way down the line. The more moves that are completed correctly, the more points your team scores.

The game is ready to play and includes 95 dance cards of varying genre and difficulty, 5 wild cards, a 90-second sand timer, scoring pads, and pencils.

Telegruv is the party game that gets you on your feet!

88156.name: Pareidolix
88156.description:
Pareidolix is an independently published role-playing game written by Andrew Morris and published by Plague Monkey Games. It was originally titled Unistat, but the name was changed in 2009 to avoid confusion with the Unisystem RPG, as well as the Unistat computer software. It is mechanically simple and encourages a cinematic arc with power shifting from the GM to the players over the course of the game. No setting is provided for Pareidolix, and the game can be used for any setting the GM and/or the players desire.

The game has only four rules: the Rule of Consensus, the Rule of Conflicts, the Rule of Concept, and the Rule of Cool. The Rule of Consensus states that as long as the players (including the GM) agree on something; it happens, and there is no need to roll dice. The Rule of Conflicts explains the procedures for handling disputes about the fictional events. The Rule of Concept shows how a player mechanically benefits in conflicts that connect to his or her character. The Rule of Cool provides a way for players to reward each other for enhancing their experience.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pareidolix", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88157.name: Vindictus
88157.description:
From the "Introduction" on the web site:

Brutal Physics
Blood spurts from enemies, right where your twin blades sliced. Enemies fall, only to become corpses you can hoist and brandish as sadistic weapons. Watch as walls crumble and whole buildings topple, providing you with new toys in the battlefield. With Source Engine physics and destructible, interactive environments, Vindictus redefines everything you thought you knew about "free-to-play."

Party Play
When a spider three times your height skitters toward you, you'll want one party member to whip a chain around its legs to pin it in place and another to distract it by flinging debris from a nearby pile of rubble, all so you can sneak behind and unleash insane damage with your blade. On the sidelines, your final party member casts healing spells. Dungeons change each time you enter them, so you'll never get bored.

Customize Gear
Next, personalize your newly crafted gear with stats via the Enchant system and color via the Dye system. In the end, your character will be clad in gear that's powerful, stylish, and unique. Just be careful when picking your undergarments -- too much fighting can break your gear, revealing what you're wearing underneath!

The Story
The air is thick with despair, and the battles never cease. Rain falls, yet the land is barren, as if the earth has been drenched in too much bloodshed to bear fruit. Monstrous creatures lurk in every trench, cave, and valley. To survive, people have huddled together, forming ramshackle towns with high walls. Yet, cowering behind those walls does not guarantee safety...

What has become of the outside world? Few people know. Fewer care to find out. As the common folk trudge from one empty day into the next, only one thought keeps them going: the Legend. The Legend will come to pass. The people yearn for it, pray for it. They hope and believe. And because they believe, they know.

One day, they will be in Erinn.

88158.name: NPG: Bards
88158.description:
From publisher blurb:

The bard class covers a wide range of historical and mythical archetypes. The term bard entered English from Gaelic, through the Irish, Scots, and Welsh. The Gaelic bard was a poet, musician, and singer. By the Middle Ages, bards had fallen out of favor with the Scots?the crown considered bards little better than vagabonds?but remained an important facet of Irish and Welsh society. Still, the Gaelic bard was by no means the only poet, musician, and singer in Medieval Europe.

There are a wide variety of character types which the bard encompasses. In replicating these character types in a game, it is not necessary to create new classes or feats. Rather, existing classes and feats can help one to shape a character to match a particular paradigm. This is what NPG Bards has done. Inside, you will find details on the artist, the minstrel, the skald, and the tragedian. All these are character archetypes that fit into the concept of the bard, some more closely than others. Each of these includes a character to illustrate how one can use existing classes, skills, and feats to replicate this type of character.

88159.name: NPG: Clerics
88159.description:
From publisher blurb:

Of all the classes in d20, the cleric may be the oddest inclusion. Our world's history is replete with famous religious fi gures, but few of them could be considered adventurers. Most clerics led lives of seclusion, their confl ict dogmatic rather than cinematic. Still, there are some examples of adventurous religious individuals from our own history. Th ough the legacy of the Crusades to the Holy Land is controversial at this time, the image of the militant monastic orders remains a strong one.
