The sea contest will be evenly match and you better take into account bad weather as it sinks more ships than enemy action.
Siege warfare takes a prominent role in this game as every city in the game map is a walled on with his own intrinsic garrison.
Like all the games of this Series, the rules are simple and straight forward. Our objective was to create games that are very interactive, and offer players a pleasant creative experience. We aim for solid games for players who do not have the time or the space to leave a game setup and in place over a long period of play.

Components:
- 1 80x60 cm map of Sicily and North Africa.
- two ten-sided dice
- 176 unit counters
- 1 Rules Book for the Series “Campaign Commander” and Exclusive Rules of “Punic Island”; historical and designer notes.
- 70 cards (divided in two decks, plus help cards)
- 3 plastic bags.
88246.name: Campaign Commander Volume III: Punic Island

88248.name: MiYu the Game
88248.description:
With this game players will try to look into their future.

The game is placed in the center of the table. Each turn the player swings the pendulum above the board. The place where the pendulum lands decides wether a player has to use the 'moodring'.
The 'moodring' at the end of the pendulum changes its color when it's put on the player's finger. The player takes the corresponding assignment card and has to fulfill the assignment.
The game also contents 'magic stones'. These stones are needed with some of the assignments.

The object of the game is to learn more about yourself, your friends or about your future.

88249.description: Identik, the red expansion, contains 40 cards thus adding 80 new images to the game, funnier and more hilarious than ever.
88249.name: Identik Extension Rouge

88250.description: Identik, the blue expansion, contains 40 cards thus adding 80 new images to the game, funnier and more hilarious than ever.
88250.name: Identik Extension Bleu

88251.name: On the Run
88251.description:
User Summary

You control a man in a spacesuit with a jetpack, manouvering him through a maze of tunnels. You have an hour to score as many points as possible. The tunnels are full of monsters, who move either randomly or in a programmed pattern. If they touch you, you lose time and when the timer reaches zero, the game ends. There are also items to pick up, giving you points and in one case, increasing your available time again.

88252.name: Epic Dungeon
88252.description:
From the official website:

Epic Dungeon
The Ultimate Dungeon Crawling Experience
4 Playable Classes
Dozens of Monsters
Loads of Glittering Loot
Unique Encounter System
50 Deadly Dungeon Levels
All for 80 Points!
Upgrade your skills, stats, and equipment as you forge your path to victory!

December 2010 on XBox Live Indie Games

boardgameimplementation.61487: Unconditional Surrender! World War 2 in Europe

88253.description:
Unconditional Surrender! Case Blue (USCB) is a small, free Print-n-Play two player game covering the World War II military campaigns fought in southern Russia during 1942-1943. One side controls the Axis forces, while the other side controls the forces of the Soviet Union.

GMT Games printed it, with real counters, in their C3I magazine issue #28 in 2014.

USCB is a derived from the game Unconditional Surrender! World War 2 in Europe (USE). Using essentially the same mechanics (plus naval units, strategic warfare, diplomacy, etc.), USE covers the entire war in the European Theater. With only 80 counters, a small map, and much shorter rulebook, Unconditional Surrender! Case Blue provides an opportunity to try out the core of USE's systems.

Design Highlights

Scale: army and air fleet level units; 30 miles per hex; monthly turns
Simple Stacking: Up to one air and ground unit per hex.
No Factors on Counters: There are no combat or movement factors on the counters.
Single Combat System: One combat resolution sequence and Combat Results Table covers air and ground combat, but the results differ for each type.
Integrated Movement/Combat System: Units move and fight in a combined activation.
Historical or Variable Entry: Units and events can enter play using an historical or variable time line.
88253.name: Unconditional Surrender! Case Blue

88254.name: Fruity Bugs
88254.description:
User Description:

Fruity Bugs is a game from the Tesco Junior range for 2 to 4 players aged 4 and up. The game includes one clockwork, strawberry board, 4 worm cards (1 blue, 1 green, 1 red and 1 yellow) and 20 green worms with coloured tail ends, 5 worms in each of the 4 colours.

You set the game up by randomly placing the worms in the holes in the strawberry and then each player selects a colour. The aim of the game is to be the first player to get all 5 worms in your colour. There is a lever at the top of the board, pull it and release to make the worms start wiggling (you'll have to repeat this frequently throughout the game as it only lasts for 10 seconds or so).

Once started players take it in turns, beginning with the youngest player, to grab a worm from the strawberry. If it matches their card they keep it, if not they put it back and then the next player goes. You keep going around until one player gets all of their 5 worms.

This is a very simple kids memory game with a dexterity element as you try and grab the wiggling worms as they move up and down in the board.

88255.name: Walking Dots
88255.description:
This game is played on a 8x8 square board.
Setup:Each player drops two friendly stones on empty cells.
On each turn,each player passes or drops a friendly stone on an empty cell orthogonally adjacent to another friendly stone.
When both players pass,wins the player with more stones.

88256.name: Duplo
88256.description:
This game is played on a 8x8 square board.
Setup:Initially,each player drops two friendly stones on empty cells.
On each turn,each player expands a connected line of one or more friendly stones.
A line of stones expands by doubling its size in one of the two directions it is defined.
When the board is full,wins the player with more friendly stones.

88257.name: Street Fighter III New Generation
88257.description:
User Summary
The first entry in Capcom's Street Fighter III series. Initially released to arcades and also included in Street Fighter III: Double Impact on Sega Dreamcast.

As with earlier Street Fighter games, Street Fighter III features one-on-one combat. Notable changes include the "parry" system, which allows players to deflect incoming attacks without taking damage. The new meter system requires players to select a single "super art" before the match, which will also determine how large the player's meter is. A full meter enables use of the Super Art, and smaller portions can be used for so-called EX moves which are improved versions of basic special moves.

The game was notable for its vast increase in the number of frames used in character animations, and for introducing an all-new cast of characters, except for Ken and Ryu.

88258.name: Avalon Code
88258.description:
From the back of the box:

A horrifying dream draws you into an amazing journey.

Use the Book of Prophecy to record and alter everything you encounter. Control the strength of your weapons and foes.

Gather information and use it to write the story of the new world.

88259.name: Dragon Slayers
88259.description:
Blurb from publisher's web site:

"The bumpkins in this pissant mountain town could never have taken down that dragon. Their biggest hero hasn’t seen battle since Drozzek rode down from the Smoking Mountains three wars-to-end-all-wars ago. So yeah, we rode into town, a bunch of outsiders ready to solve that problem. And no, we don’t care what they think. And yes, we’re heroes. These yokels should worship at our feet. They sure as hell didn’t slay that dragon. That’s our dragon, and its gold is our gold. So unless you’re bringing us ale and whores, get the fuck out before we transform you into a turkey and serve you for dinner."

This playset, written by Logan Bonner focuses on the fallout after a group of gung-ho fantasy adventurers wipes out a mythical monster, and then sticks around to reap their well-earned rewards.

88260.name: Street Fighter III 2nd Impact
88260.description:
User Summary
The second installment in the Street Fighter III series. Similar to Street Fighter III: New Generation, 2nd Impact added, Hugo, Urien and Akuma. It also increased the number of frames during which a parry could be activated.

Released initially in arcades and later as part of Street Fighter III: Double Impact on Sega Dreamcast.

88262.name: Mega Man Zero Collection
88262.description:
Capcom bundled all four Mega Man Zero games in a single release for the Nintendo DS titled Mega Man Zero Collection (Rockman Zero Collection in Japan). The game was released in North America on June 8, 2010, two days later in Japan and Australia, and was slated for release in Europe on 11 June 2010, however, release in the European region has been patchy, with the game not being released in some nations.

No changes have been made to the games in comparison with the original versions, but a few new features were added to the compilation, like an artwork gallery and the ability to remap certain actions to different buttons, as well as an "Easy Scenario" mode that allow the four games to be played as if they were as a single one, with some alterations to make the game easier (e.g. blocks covering spikes, no need to feed Elves, etc.).

Source: Wikipedia, "Mega Man Zero Collection," available under the CC-BY-SA License.' '

88263.name: Justin Bieber Backstage Pass Game
88263.description: Publisher Description: Justin's got a special message for you. Be the first BACKSTAGE before your friends beat you there! Prove you got the lowdown on Justin's life and his music. Correctly answer the questions as you race through the concert hall. Justin's secret message is waiting for you backstage. Fast and fun, Justin's trivia will keep you and your friends guessing to see who's the biggest fan.

88266.name: HEXETERA™ - Triangle Puzzle Game
88266.description:
From the official website:

HEXETERA is an instantly-playable iPhone and iPod Touch triangles puzzle game for everyone.

Charge your batteries and get ready to move, explode, rotate, color, destroy and drop triangle pieces we call PRIMARIES to create single color Hexagon (HEXA) and Diagonal (DIA) target formations for different levels.

Watch out for SECONDARIES, falling pieces that help or hinder you. Power up with Reward Buttons. Earn these when you make formations and charge through your levels. Levels get faster and targets get harder …hexetera, hexetera!

88267.name: G.M. Magazine (Issue 14 - Oct 1989)

rpgissue.4032: G.M. - The Independent Fantasy Roleplaying Magazine

88267.description:
Contents

•News
•James Herbert Interview
•The World of Superheroes - GM's guide to the RPGs and costumed crusaders by Gary O'Connell
•Reviews - Batman, Albedo, Reorx, Save the President, Mission Arcturus, Family Business
•Lone Wolf and the Fortress of Doom by Joe Dever
•Win Warlock Videos
•Win a skateboard
•Haunted - an extract from James Herbert's latest paperback best-seller
•LRP
•The Paint Shop by Paul Benson
•BORT - a science fiction scenario by Jon Sutherland & Nidel Gross
•Books by Alan Crump
•Covention Corner
•Zine Scene
•Comics by Philip Morton
•Q and A
•PBM Update by Wayne
•The Axeman Cometh!
•Contacts
•Critical Hits by David Langford

88268.name: Cairn Lands
88268.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Cairn Lands were once the home of the Vindari, an ancient culture which exists today only as faded inscriptions on the walls of crumbling ruins and barrow mounds. Today, this largely unsettled land is a rural backwater, famous for little save the Cairn Hills, that dark upland amid whose valleys walk the restless dead.

88269.name: Gateway
88269.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Gateway; The scavenger isle, the pirate isle. Gateway floats on the fringes of the monster haunted ruins of the Shattered City, and is the first port of call for those seeking to make their fortune. Gateway is home to a transient mass of scavengers, criminals, pirates, gangs and thrill seekers.

However, Gateway is not a total haven from the dangers of the Shattered City, it holds dangers of its own aplenty. Street gangs rule the streets, menacing islanders trying to go about their lives unmolested; combatants risk life and limb in the semi-legal fighting pits; crime lords, and pirate kings rule over the desperate and downtrodden whilst luxuriating in riches and combat; finally, those who have been maimed and scarred by the Shattered City are banding together under their beggar king to siez\e control of the island.

88270.name: Evernight: noc bohaterów (Edycja limitowana)
88270.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Evernight: Noc Bohaterów to świat dark fantasy, jakiego jeszcze nie było. Podręcznik zawiera gotową do poprowadzenia kampanię, opowiadającą losy inwazji tajemniczych, krwiożerczych Władców od jej pierwszych chwil aż po krwawy finał. Bohaterowie zaczynają grę jako Nowicjusze w doskonale znanym świecie elfów, krasnoludów, orków i ludzi. Nim staną się prawdziwymi Herosami, wszędzie zapanuje ciemność i groza. Podręcznik zawiera ponadto nowe przewagi, zawady, nadprzyrodzone moce i magiczne przedmioty oraz specjalne reguły tworzenia i rozwoju drużyny bohaterów. Mistrzowie Gry otrzymują kompletną kampanię, która ujawnia tajemnicę kryjącą się w zamierzchłej przeszłości świata, cały legion nowych potworów, generatory przygód oraz wskazówki, jak wykorzystać świat Tarth jako scenerię konwencjonalnej kampanii fantasy, w czasach poprzedzających główny wątek. A wszystko to dostajecie przed premierą wznowienia na świecie!

and from the back of the base product:

"Rage Against The Dying Of The Light!

The world of Tarth was a bright and shining jewel. The Great Race Wars were long over, the people were free, and true evil had been scattered to the dark bowels of the earth.

The King of Valusia sat upon his throne and ruled his peaceful valley and its honest citizens with a firm yet fair grip.

The future of Tarth was bright.

Until they came.

And the light went out forever.

Evernight is a very different kind of dark fantasy setting. This 144-page hardback book provides a complete scripted campaign, from before the arrival of the mysterious and terrifying Masters to the epic and bloody finish.

Player characters start as Novices in a familiar fantasy world of elves, dwarves, orcs and men. They finish as Heroic adventurers in a land draped in eternal night and overwhelming horror.

Evernight contains new Edges & Hindrances, spells, weapons and magical items. The Game Master has a complete scene by scene campaign ready to run, the truth behind Tarth's murky past, and a host of new and mysterious monsters!"

88271.name: The Ice
88271.description:
Blurb from the publisher's web site:

Our friend Pavel Berlin found it intolerable that we didn't have any playsets in Russian, and set out to correct that. Since he was doing the hard work of translating anyway, we thought why not make it look awesome?

Why not, indeed? So here's the Russian version of The Ice, one of the four playsets that are included when you buy Fiasco. Thanks Pavel, and Наслаждайтесь!

88272.name: Doctor Who: Return to Earth
88272.description:
User Summary

The Doctor and Amy arrive on an abandoned spaceship near Jupiter and have to pilot it back to Earth, along the way confronting Daleks, Cybermen and other baddies! The game is a combination of third person, FPS and mini-puzzles and features the voices of the original cast of the TV series Doctor Who.

88273.name: Sonic Screwdriver Wiimote
88273.description:
User Summary

A Wii controller in the shape of the 11th Doctor's Sonic Screwdriver from the TV series 'Doctor Who'.

88274.name: Dweredell
88274.description:
Publisher blurb:

A CITY FALLEN UNTO RUIN...

Three hundred years ago Dweredell was a teeming metropolis: The last city on the road to the great dwarven kingdoms of the east. The trade which passed through its gates was born from dwarven forges and western realms, and the riches which came with that trade made Dweredell a jewel among cities. Its people prospered, and its fortunes seemed endless.

But the dwarven kingdoms fell, and Dweredell lost its glory. The traffic from the east vanished. And, with Dweredell as the road's end, the merchants of the west soon realized that the city had nothing to offer them. The city slowed, and then it began to die...

88275.name: The Fantasy Sagas: Player's Guidebook
88275.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Fantasy Sagas is the first of a series of guidebooks created for the E-RPG system; an epic character driven, story-focused RPG. While many games exist that offer immersive and exciting worlds to play in, the creators of the E-RPG system believe that the stories always should have a focus on the driving characters in the drama. These are the characters created by the players of the game. The first of three separate rulebooks for players The Fantasy Sagas is only the first genre to be released. Each of the subsequent books (Modern and Sci-Fi Sagas) will use the same rule-set and so are completely compatible with each other, allowing game styles to be mixed and matched in any way a player or Game Master can imagine. Players can play in worlds that use any of the special features of one game type with another without making any special adjustments. Imagine playing in a world of computers, guns, and magic!

88276.name: Crossbows and Catapults Master Battle Set
88276.description:
Discover an amazing world of warrior heroes, towering castles and brilliant, all-action battles to play with your friends.

The gameplay is fantastic fun - including crossbows and catapults that really do work. Castle towers with "explosive" special effects that send your enemies flying and some serious spells to cast upon anyone who dares oppose you.

So set out your castle keeps, tents, towers, crossbows and catapults. Build your rampart defenses and place your warriors in strategic positions. Then take it in turns to fire your projectiles - including the deadly fireballs, boiling oil and boulder bursts. Destroy your enemies defenses and weapons of awesome power before the destroy you.

Good luck and may glorious victory be yours!

88277.name: Word Bluff Table Top Game
88277.description: This is a card game that is a bluffing word guessing game. Each card has three possible answers for each word on the card. Only one of them is correct, can you guess which one?

88278.name: Vampire Translation Guide
88278.description:
From the back cover:

Have you always wanted to include the Ravnos into your Requiem game? Or perhaps the Invictus into your Masquerade game? This guide will help you translate the feel and core elements from each version of Vampire into the other game system and background.

This book includes:

Translations of all of the clans between versions of Vampire
Suggestions and ideas on how to use certain rules and setting elements in each version of the game
Key Disciplines converted for use into the opposite game system




A copy of Vampire: The Masquerade Revised Edition, the World of Darkness core rulebook, and Vampire: The Requiem are all recommended for use with this product.

88279.name: D6 Space Opera
88279.description:
Source: Wikipedia D6 Space
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

D6 Space was originally released in 2003 as a PDF format ebook under the name D6 Space Opera by Humanoids Publishing. It was sold as a core rulebook for their line of Shatterzone PDF re-releases. This was greatly expanded and revised by author Nikola Vrtis into the current D6 Space Rulebook (ISBN 978-1-932867-01-5), released in 2004 by Purgatory Publishing imprint West End Games.

88280.name: Tin Star
88280.description:
This is a set of tactical rules for gun-fights and shoot-outs in the setting of the American Wild West. The gun-fights take place as a table top miniature game which uses 25mm scale miniatures. The rules cover everything that is needed to play including character design and stats, scenario creation and even rules for campaign games. There are floor plans included in the rule book, or the game master can create their own.

The battles can take place outdoors for example in the middle of a western town, or even indoors, such as in saloons, banks, etc. Once each player has his character or gang of characters, then each player takes turns moving and firing at each other until there is one player (or team) remaining.

88281.name: For a Few Miniatures More
88281.description: This is an expansion book for Fistfull of Miniatures, which contains Scenarios, Army Lists, and New Rules for A Fistfull of Miniatures.

88282.description:
MIND CONTROL HELMET
Pay 3 Fuel to move an opponent's
ship to a different Orbital Facility and
use it as if it were your own ship.

The ship may not change value during the
move and may not be moved onto or
off the Terraforming Station.


The Mind Control Helmet costs more to use than the Orbital Teleporter because you're using a larger pool of other players' ships, almost guaranteeing you can find the right number to accomplish your goal.

It has all of the same restrictions as the Orbital Teleporter...
Cannot remove a ship from the Terraforming Station
Cannot change the ship's value in transit
Cannot use it at the same facility it came from

...plus one extra restriction...
Cannot move a ship onto the Terraforming Station


Two MCH cards were included free if you pre-ordered the base game from the second print run.

A limited quantity of MCH cards are available for separate purchase.

The MCH is included with all copies of the game as of the 3rd edition.
88282.name: Alien Frontiers: The Mind Control Helmet

88283.name: Toki

videogamehonor.29219: 1992 Golden Joystick Best Coin-Op Conversion of the Year Winner

88283.description:
The protagonist of the game is a muscular, loin-cloth wearing, Tarzan-esque tribesman named Toki, who up until recently lived a primitive yet contented life in the jungles of a vast and wild island in the South Seas.

This all ends tragically when the beautiful Miho, princess of Toki's tribe of jungle men, and a potential suitor to Toki, is kidnapped by the treacherous witch doctor Vookimedlo. Miho is taken to a vast golden palace at the summit of the island, which Vookimedlo has conjured up for himself to reside in. The wicked shaman then casts a spell to transform all the human inhabitants of the island into various animals and beasts, before they can defend themselves against the evil magic.

Toki himself is transformed into a Geeshergam; one of the ape-like minions of Vookimedlo; although in his primate form Toki more resembles a gorilla. Fortunately the great warrior discovers that he is still in control of his own faculties and as an unexpected side effect of the spell cast on him, he can breathe fire and shoot forth various projectiles from his mouth.

Toki then sets off on a quest to pursue and defeat Vookimeldo, rescue princess Miho, and undo the curse which has befallen the island. However, to reach Vookimedlo's golden palace, Toki will have to travel through murky lakes, steep canyons, over frozen ice-capped mountain ranges and lava-spewing volcanoes alike. To progress in his quest and be ultimately victorious, Toki will have to battle all manner of dangerous wild animals and various mutants of Vookimedlo's creation; not to mention Vookimedlo's own abominable guardians who act as level bosses.

Source: Wikipedia, "Toki," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88285.name: Claw
88285.description:
Join forces with Captain Claw, the greatest cat pirate ever to challenge the Cocker Spaniard Armada! Help him defeat his enemies in this action-packed quest for the Amulet of Nine Lives.

Source: The Game Website.

88287.name: Michael Jackson's Moonwalker (Arcade)
88287.description:
The story, which is taken from the Moonwalker film, follows Michael, using various music and dance related abilities, on a quest to save kidnapped children from the hands of the evil "Mr. Big". The games incorporated synthesized versions of the musician's hits, such as "Beat It" and "Smooth Criminal". With completely different gameplay to the home computer versions, Moonwalker was developed into an arcade video game by Sega (programming) and Triumph International (audiovisuals), with the help of Jackson which was released on the Sega System 18 hardware.

The game is essentially a beat-em-up, although Jackson attacks with magic powers instead of physical contact, and has the ability to shoot magic power at enemies instead of getting close enough for a melee attack. A map of the stage is shown before it begins, and after which, Jackson must get from the start to the end without losing all his health, rescuing all the children and defeating all the enemies along the way.

The game can also be played multiplayer; if the cabinet supports it, up to three people can play simultaneously. All three players play as Jackson, dressed in his suit from the "Smooth Criminal" music video. The first player wears a white suit and hat, with a blue shirt; the second player's character dons a scarlet outfit with a white shirt; the third player's character is dressed in black, with a red shirt. The characters all have armbands: blue for white outfit, white for red outfit, and red for black outfit.

Source: Wikipedia, "Michael Jackson's Moonwalker", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88288.name: Michael Jackson's Moonwalker (Console)
88288.description:
The story, which is taken from the Moonwalker film, follows Michael, using various music and dance related abilities, on a quest to save kidnapped children from the hands of the evil "Mr. Big". The games incorporated synthesized versions of the musician's hits, such as "Beat It" and "Smooth Criminal".

Home versions of the game were released for Sega's Mega Drive/Genesis and Master System home video game systems, as well as the Sega Game Gear handheld system, though the gameplay was completely different from the arcade version. A version has also been rated by PEGI for an upcoming release on Virtual Console.[4], but no confirmation of which version. The home console versions of the game were actually based on an evolved version of the home computer version of the game (with gameplay somewhat similar to the Shinobi series), in contrast to the arcade version which was a three-quarters view shooter/fighter type game. The game involved the player controlling the pop star in a quest to save all the kids that had been kidnapped by Mr. Big. In the arcade version, Katie was one of three types of children who could be rescued, in the home version, all of the captive children are young blond girls termed "Katies", although Zeke appears in the end sequence.

The game's levels and music were borrowed from the film (though many of the music tracks were taken from Jackson's Thriller album as well) and the player had the ability to destroy enemies by making them dance. In the console game Michael could become a robot by rescuing a certain child first, and then grabbing a comet that fell from the sky. In the arcade version, Michael became a robot by rescuing his chimp pal Bubbles. The arcade version also had the novel feature of three simultaneous players (each controlling Jackson's character in a different-colored "Smooth Criminal" outfit).

The gameplay is focused on finding children, all of whom resemble Katie from the movie, which are scattered throughout the level, some behind certain objects such as doors. Most of the objects are empty or contain enemies. In contrast to the arcade version, Michael's moves more closely resemble his trademark dancing moves. For example, the standard attack is a stylized high kick that is commonly incorporated into his dance routines. If the player continues to hold the kick button, and moves michael backwards, he performs Michael's signature Moonwalk dance move. The player has combination health/ability bar. One button will allow Michael to spin, being invulnerable in the process. However, this spin move will slowly lose health. If the spin is held for more than two seconds, Michael will throw his hat in a fashion of a boomerang which will destroy most enemies. The longer the spin move is held, the wider distance that the fedora will cover. If held down long enough, a dance magic scene similar to the arcade version would play, featuring dance moves taken from the film clips of whatever song is playing in the background. Michael can also use the magic to slide down banisters and eliminate multiple enemies in the process. In certain levels, a shooting star may appear which temporarily transforms Micheal into a cyborg that can attack enemies with various artillery, though cannot collect children. Almost every stage has three levels, designated in Super Mario Bros. fashion as X-1, X-2, X-3. However, the final level of the Mega Drive/Sega Genesis version was a first person "flight sim" type battle between Michael (now transformed into a space ship) and Mr. Big's ship.

Source: Wikipedia, "Michael Jackson's Moonwalker", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88289.description:
Laste mälumängudoomino is a junior version of Mälumängudoomino

Game mechanics are the same: trivia game with domino pieces. The tiles have two categories marked on them, out of total ten. The tile placement follows normal domino rules, but each time you are placing a tile, you have to answer a question on the topic marked on the tile in question. The categories in the game are: history, people, nature, geography, computers & technology, entertainment, sports, Estonia, culture and various other information.

The game includes:
100 question cards with 1000 questions
55 domino tiles
88289.name: Laste mälumängudoomino

88290.name: Michael Jackson's Moonwalker
88290.description:
The story, which is taken from the Moonwalker film, follows Michael, using various music and dance related abilities, on a quest to save kidnapped children from the hands of the evil "Mr. Big". The games incorporated synthesized versions of the musician's hits, such as "Beat It" and "Smooth Criminal".

Versions of the game were released for the popular 8-bit and 16-bit home computers of the time. They were developed by two small softhouses, Irish Emerald Software Ltd and American Keypunch Software, and published by British company U.S. Gold; all of these have since gone out of business[1]. The home computer versions are the only games to make reference to the early portions of the film.

e games featured four different levels. The first was a top-down maze-style level based on the 'Speed Demon' short, involving wandering the studio to collect various items and costume pieces, with the final piece being the motorcycle, all whilst trying to avoid the crazed fans. Stealth elements were used, with an onscreen map similar to that used in Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake. The next level had similar gameplay, riding the motorcycle collecting tokens, upon which turning into a car in order to jump a barrier to the next part.

The third level was a sort of side-scrolling level based on the "Smooth Criminal" clip, collecting ammunition and shooting at gangsters in openings above you.

The final level involved morphing into a robot and shooting at soldiers in openings, with the player controlling a crosshair. The four songs used were "Bad", "Speed Demon", "Smooth Criminal" and "The Way You Make Me Feel".

Source: Wikipedia, "Michael Jackson's Moonwalker", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88291.name: The King of Dragons
88291.description:
The King of Dragons (ザ・キングオブドラゴンズ) is a 1991 side-scrolling hack and slash arcade game by Capcom that allows players to choose from five characters (Elf, Wizard, Fighter, Cleric, and Dwarf) in order to travel through the kingdom of Malus and defeat the monsters that have taken over, as well as their leader, the red dragon Gildiss. The setting is very similar to that of Dungeons and Dragons and other medieval fantasy worlds, with familiar monsters such as Orcs, Gnolls, Harpies, Wyverns, Cyclopes, and Minotaurs. The game has 16 levels, though many are quite short.

Much like Capcom's Knights of the Round, King of Dragons features an RPG-like level advancement system. Points scored for killing monsters and picking up gold count towards experience, and the character gains levels at regular intervals. With each level, the character's health bar increases, other attributes such as range improve, and the character also becomes invulnerable for a few seconds. Along the way, different weapon and armor upgrades for each character may also be picked up.

King of Dragons features a simple control system that consists of a single attack button, and a jump button. By pressing both buttons, the character unleashes a magical attack that strikes all enemies in screen (its strength varies according to the character used) at the expense of losing energy. The fighter, cleric and dwarf can also use their shield to block certain attacks by tilting the joystick back right before the impact.

The game was ported to the Super NES in 1994. This port reduces the number of simultaneous players down to 2. The sprites' size were also reduced moderately. It is also possible to assign the magic attack and shield defense to different buttons.

The arcade version is part of Capcom Classics Collection Vol. 2, which was released for the PS2 & Xbox in November 2006. This was also in Capcom Classics Collection: Reloaded for the PlayStation Portable.

Source: Wikipedia, "King of dragons", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88292.name: Microlite20: Purest Essence
88292.description:
From the publisher's website:

Paul Lessack has kindly contributed a beautifully laid-out version of Microlite20. Weighing in at 17 pages, it's a 1.4Mb pdf that's as close to my vision of a complete professional Edition of Microlite20 as I've seen to date. It includes Character Generation, Combat, Advancement, Monsters, Equipment, Spells and the full Expert rules and GM Guide too!

This edition also contains the expert rules for Microlite20:

This rule-set allows for introducing a few more options to your Microlite20 game, without necessarily increasing its complexity. Included are: a new skill, new races, new classes, and some other (hopefully) good stuff. It is not necessary to use Microlite20 Expert Rules in its entirety; DMs are encouraged to "cherry pick" those specific items applicable to their own campaign.

88293.name: Yatzi Zoo
88293.description: Idea of the game: The zoo is in a muddle: all the animals may get out of their enclosures and are drawn today. The colour combination of the dice decides which is the next animal to be drawn to complete one's row. Who can draw the longest row of animals. A drawing and dice game. Contains rules for older players.

88294.name: Dungeon (Issue 175 - Feb 2010)
88294.description:
Cover by INVALID OBJECT ID=43056, type=person

Issue quote:
"Tiamat who formed all things,
Made in addition weapons invicible;
she spawned monster-serpents,
Sharp of tooth, and merciless of fang;
With poison, instead of blood,
she filled their bodies.

Fierce monster-vipers
she clothed in terror,
With splendor she decked them,
she made them of lofty stature.
Whoever beheld them,
terror overcame him,
Their bodies reared up and none
could withstand their attack."
--Enuma Elish, The Epic of Creation, L.W.King trans.

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88295.name: Dungeon (Issue 176 - Mar 2010)
88295.description:
Cover by Howard Lyon

No quote was included in this issue.

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88296.description:
"BOLSA" simulates the functioning of the stock exchange in the perspective of small investors.

Throughout the year (each month = 1 round) players will have to invest or disinvest in stock in order to maximize their profit.

They can choose between 6 companies, from all sectors of activity and with 3 different profiles - high risk, medium risk and low risk.

As in the real stock exchange, quotations of each company are driven by 3 factors:
- the selling and buying orders from all players, which will bring quotation down or up
- the market trends, simulated by dice casted at the beginning of each month but with effect only at quarter end
- the always breakthrough company news from "Jornal Finanças & Bolsa", released at month end and that may impact one or more, or even all companies.

Each player will have 30 secs to plan it's moves in total secrecy and only then all players reveal their intentions.

At the end of the year you will receive yearend bonus only for the stock you have kept in your hand.

All stocks are then converted to cash and let's count the money.

The richest player wins the game
88296.name: BOLSA: the board game

88297.name: Dealing With Murder: Dead & Breakfast
88297.description:
From the back of the box:
"Deal up murder and mayhem with the simple murder mystery game that's played with cards. 'Dealing with Murder' requires no fancy parties or petit'fours, just round up your favorite rival detectives and deal them into a baffling murder mystery which unfolds as the cards are dealt.

Who will be the first detective to identify the killer? Will you cooperate with your fellow sleuths...or withhold some evidence...to give yourself an edge in solving the crime?

A singular murder mystery experience for 2 to 6 amateur detectives aged 12 to adult.

Contents include a unique 55 card deck of clues, tips and evidence; crime scene photos and suspect profiles; game instructions and a sealed crime solution.

Object of the Game:
To be the first detective to solve the crime by correctly stating 1)Who the murderer is 2) The motive, and 3) How it was accomplished.

Similar to/same series as:
Dealing With Murder: Fatal Error

boardgamehonor.12910: 2010 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Nominee

88298.description:
A simple roll and move game played on a board made of small wooden jigsaw pieces. The aim of the game is to have most jam in the end. Landing on a space may cause you to gain jam, lose jam, skip a turn or move forward on the track. Reaching the goal first gives a jam bonus.

Winner of the Children's Game of the Year 2010 in Finland.
88298.name: Muumien purnukkajahti

88299.name: Rechenakrobat
88299.description:
Rechenakrobat (Calculation Acrobat)

Rechenakrobat is game consisting out of five dice only. It is a mathematical game in which the player tries to make a correct calculation with the thrown values of the dice.

With the eyes of the 5 coloured dice the number thrown with the 2 black dice should be calculated through addition, subtraction, multiplication or division.

"Lebst Du nur, oder spielst Du schon?" / "Still living, or already playing"?

88300.name: Secret Santa
88300.description:
Santa has infiltrated the home of Sam Malton, the founder of Mal-Mart. He's on a mission to give coal to the whole family, and if he succeeds, the Holiday season is saved from commercialism. If he fails, Sam and his naughty children will reap the rewards of consumer spending.


Each player randomly and secretly takes the role of one character; Santa , Elf, Sam, Kid, Naughty Kid. Sam and his kids are trying to figure out who Santa is, while Santa is trying to give everyone in the Malton family coal.

This is a rethemed and adapted version of a specialized version of Werewolf (no moderator needed).

Game Files Here
http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/62211/secret-santa-rules
http://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/62151/secret-santa-compone...

88301.name: Biljard
88301.description: Mini version of 'Billiard' or 'Pool'. There are many different versions of this game of skill, but ultimately you have to use a cue stick with which to hit balls into the table's six pockets.

88302.name: SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Combined Assault
88302.description:
SOCOM U.S. Navy SEALs: Combined Assault is a video game for the PlayStation 2 that was released on November 7, 2006 in North America.

Combined Assault's campaign mode offers 18 missions. The game takes place solely in the fictional country of Adjikistan. The country is supposedly situated somewhere in the Afghanistan/Pakistan region of Central Asia and features a number of environment and climate zones, allowing for the game to feature a wide variety of landscapes and settings while working within one large, connected story.

Source: Wikipedia, "SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Combined Assault", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88303.name: Nutimäng
88303.description:
From the publisher:
Nutimäng is made for 4-5 year old children. It is a simple story telling game, in which adults can aim their kids if needed.Each time you give your kid and question or task, let them finish it and then check the other side of the card if they got it. First child to collect 5 correct tasks/questions is the winner.

The game is put together from national children educational standards.

88304.name: Sobid või mitte?
88304.description:
From the publisher:
Easiest party game for couples. This game is a good way to learn about your friends and family, to find people who think like you.
The couple that wins the game is the one who "clicks" more and gets to the finish first. Only thing you need to do in this game is to pick words from word pairs and then check, if your partner thinks the same. Is it blond or dark - your choice?

88305.name: Roheline Tuli
88305.description:
From the publisher:
We all take part in traffic and knowing it is not just for drivers. This educational card game teaches about traffic and it contains 40 cards: 36 traffic sign, 3 traffic lights and 1 rule card. It can be used to teach about traffic signs, but it also is a party game for kids as well. The game is simple, you just need get rid of your cards by finding companion traffic sign. Sound easy enough, so now lets start teaching the youngsters...

88306.name: Grease: The Official Video Game
88306.description:
User Summary

Grease: The Official Video Game is a combination rhythm and party game for the Wii and DS. The game is based on the 1978 musical by the same name, and includes a range of features that are true to the film.

Players can compete in two teams of up to four players each, singing and dancing to 16 songs from the movie. One team takes the role of the T-Birds, while the other sides with the Pink Ladies. The dancing is controlled by the Wii Remote and Wii Balance Board, while the singing employs a USB microphone.

Players dance and sing to the songs, but can also participate in a number of mini-games that are based on the movie, including a drag race against the Scorpions or carnival games at the graduation carnival. Story mode places the player in the role of Danny as he tries to earn the affection of Sandy with his slick dance moves.

The DS version is a more basic title, and includes 10 songs. Players tap to the beat in the strictly rhythm based game.

88307.name: Game Dev Story

videogamehonor.32448: 2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

88307.description:
From the company's website:

Manage your own game company and try to create a million-selling game in this unique simulation.

88308.name: Worlds of Wonder
88308.description:
From the back of the box:

Worlds of Wonder contains 3 complete role-playing games, interchangeable in concepts and rules, and supported by a fourth rule set, Basic Role-Playing (1980 Edition), in turn supplying a general introduction and elementary rules for Magic World. Superworld, and Future World. Included are four booklets, a scenario for each world, character record sheets, play-aids, six dice, and introduction to the city of Wonder, character silhouettes, and other enclosures.

This game is complete — there is nothing else to buy.

88309.name: Mecha Aces
88309.description:
From the back of the book:

"Mecha Aces uses the FUDGE system as a foundation, and builds upon the system to create the perfect synergy between a pilot and their machine. Mecha Aces re-examines the mecha/pilot paradigm in RPG's and establishes and innovative system built around the simplicity of the FUDGE system, and the power within the system's potential."

Areas covered:


Mecha and the pilots who drive them.
FUDGE foundation toolset
Magic
Psychic powers
Techniques
Artificial intelligence
Racing
Stock Settings

88312.name: Dungeon (Issue 177 - Apr 2010)
88312.description:
Cover by Ralph Horsley

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88313.name: Dungeon (Issue 178 - May 2010)
88313.description:
Cover by Raoul Vitale

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88315.name: The Knife
88315.description:
user summary

The Knife is a scenario for Call of Cthulhu.

In this adventure the investigators are faced with a serial killer on the loose in a modern day town. But maybe this serial killer is under the influence of a mythos threat.

88316.description:
Autokrator (a.k.a. emperor) is a medieval Euro/wargame about the wars from the 7th to the 11th century between Christians and Muslims. In Autokrator, you control one of the major kingdoms/Caliphates of the Medieval Age – the Franks/Holy Roman Empire, the Moors, the Saracens, the East Roman Empire (Byzantines) – with each kingdom striving to protect and expand its domination.

The players use four characters each round – the King, the General, the Admiral, and the Garrison – with each character having special abilities. What's more, each player has his own "battlecard" deck of armies and must divide them strategically between his characters at the begining of every new turn. The original combat system is based on the choices that the players have, and the battle is fought between five battlefields: Plain, Hill, Forest, City and Ambush. The game lasts five rounds, and players win or lose victory points based on the winning battles and the territories that they control.

Make your choices wisely, and take a chance on becoming the next Autokrator!
88316.name: Autokrator

88317.name: Thonahexus 3
88317.description:
Contents
2 - The Swamp Queen A Common Knowledge story from the Anoth Delta.
4 - Wine in western Lythia A look at the wine culture and wine business of western Lythia.
9 - The Morsina A close look at the Dark Elves of Hârn.
13 - Saint Abræron’s Chalice Adventure Seed
14 - Khuzdul Legacy A guided tour of the Khuzdul statues in the Ulmirien River valley

88321.name: Thonahexus 4
88321.description:
Contents
2 - The Malnoren of Loala An introduction to the isolated and enigmatic county of Loala in Shorkyne´
8 - Trepura & The Lado College On the eastern coast of Loala stand the crumbling ruins of Trepura—home to The Beggars from the Sea
20 - Lado Village An island of civilization in a sea of anarchy
26 - The Imperial Vintage An adventure among the ruins of Trepura.
31 - The Wreckers of the Coast Adventure Seed: A short tale about some not very nice people.
32 - Sonise A small but prospering keep on Loala’s northern coast.
40 - The Question of a Hârnic Dark Age

88322.name: Dark Throne
88322.description:
Dark Throne is a free browser-based massive online game featuring interaction between thousands of players in a virtual fantasy world. Attacking and pillaging nearby kingdoms, defending against incoming attacks, and sending covert spy missions against other players are just some of the unique and challenging online gaming experiences found in Dark Throne.

Dark Throne also includes customizable profiles, an expansive alliance system, online friends lists, a message center, and forum. These features power an experience designed to promote social interaction and foster friendships between players.

Source: The Game Website.

88323.name: Thonahexus 5
88323.description:
Contents
2 - The Written Word "On the different scripts of the Lakise alphabet, by Dean Gustus of The University of Berema."
4 - Ruins of Hârn An essay on the architectural remnants on Hârn.
10 - Imeruva: The Court of Illusions An enigma hidden in the hills of Loala.
15 - Ostelones A town in Loala eager to regain its former glory.
24 - Tolbeth Manor An isolated manor that holds a dark secret.

88324.name: Thonahexus 6
88324.description:
Contents
2 - The Town Cryer Thoughts from the HârnForum & beyond
3 - Godstones Chaotic, lethal, and the keys to Kelestia.
8 - The Company of the Cup Golotha - a dark secret binds these men together.
10 - What do you call a Knight? How do you avoid getting your head cut off when adressing a nobleman?
12 - Highways & Tolls How to travel the highways of Hârn - and how not to.
16 - Genheim A settlement in Orbaal.
22 - St Melik’s Broadsword An adventure in the cold land of Orbaal
26 - Holegore The gate to Loala - a riverside town filled with intrigue and thievery.

Included with with issue was also character forms for 11 characters in Excel spreadsheets format.

88325.name: Thonahexus 7
88325.description:
Contents
2 - Campaign Talk How do your fellow gamemasters run their games?
16 - Pilgrims and Relics Travelling the lands in search of blessings and hope.
20 - Gnostic Interpretation of Hârnic Religion Religions on Hârn is not an easy subject. Will this essay perhaps shed some light over the gods?
26 - Conspiracy Theory The truth isn’t always easy to find. But sometimes it’s just in front of your eyes - if you dare to look ...
30 - The Graesha The tree devils of the Loalan forest.

88327.name: Collector
88327.description:
Collector is played on a 6x6 square board.
On each turn,a player must drop a friendly stone and a neutral stone,both on adjacent empty cells.
When all cells are occupied,wins the player with the largest group.
Collector is presented at 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris.

88328.description:
Promotional card included in orders from Plaid Hat Games for a period.

Khan Queso is a Champion of the Mercenaries, and his special ability reads:

Plague
After moving Khan Queso, you must roll a die once for each unit that is adjacent to Khan Queso. On a result of 5 or higher, that unit receives one wound marker.
88328.name: Summoner Wars: Khan Queso

88329.description:
Promotional card included with orders from Plaid Hat Games for a limited time period.

Sairook is a Champion of the Mercenaries, his special ability reads:

Shadow Summon
If Sairook is on the battlefield at the end of your turn, you may choose to remove all wound markers from Sairook and place him back in your hand.
88329.name: Summoner Wars: Sairook

88330.name: Ambivalence
88330.description:
Ambivalence is played on a 6x6 square board. On each turn, each player drops a friendly stone on an empty cell.

In the following cases, stones are transformed into neutral stones:

Custodian: An enemy stone becomes neutral when placed between two friendly stones.
Intrusion: Two enemy stones becomes neutral when a friendly stone is dropped between them.




When the board is full, the player with more friendly stones wins.

Ambivalence is listed as Ambivalente in 100 Strategic Games for Pen and Paper by Walter Joris.

88331.name: Jailbreaker
88331.description:
User Summary

In Jailbreaker, you play as a character attempting to escape a prison. You run from left to right, and either jump over or slide under the various obstacles in your way. If you mistime a jump or a slide, you stop completely, and get caught by the prisonguards.

88332.name: Climber! (2010)
88332.description:
User Summary

In Climber, you control a character who finds himself in a postapocalyptic vision of a city. Armed only with a grappling hook, you must use steel girders to climb ever higher. If you miss, you will plummet straight to the ground again.

88333.name: Old School Monster Statblock Reference
88333.description:
from the cover

"An abbreviated listing of canonical men & monsters for use by a DM with Advanced Dungeons & Dragons adventures."

user comment
Almost 100 pages of condensed stat blocks for monsters and NPCs listed in alphabetical order.

rpgseries.8869: Wizards of the Coast - Free Adventure Downloads

88334.name: Tomb of Horrors (Revised)
88334.description:
From the Introduction:

In the far reaches of the world, under a lost and lonely hill, lies the sinister Tomb of Horrors. Terrible traps, strange and ferocious monsters, rich and magical treasures, and an evil demilich fill this labyrinthine crypt.

The original version of this module was first used for the official ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS® tournament at Origins I in 1974. Next it was published as Dungeon Module S1 in 1981 using the 1st edition rules. The module was later expanded in Return to the Tomb of Horrors in 1998 using the 2nd edition rules. However, the original tomb was never actually updated - it was reprinted as it originally saw print. Now, twenty-one years after its first appearance, the original module is finally being updated to the latest incarnation of the DUNGEONS & DRAGONS® rules (3.5).

88335.name: Old School Spells Reference
88335.description:
from the cover

"A comprehensive listing of magic-user, illusionist, cleric and druid spells, published by TSR for use with 1st edition Advanced Dungeons & Dragons featuring compiled commentaries & notes."

88336.name: Old School Dungeon Geomorphs
88336.description:
from the cover

"A set of 60 interlocking map tiles for quick design of caves, catacombs, mines and dungeons. Usable with any gaming system."

88337.name: Old School Encounters Reference
88337.description:
from the cover

"This unauthorized reference sourcebook contains everything the Dungeon Master needs for designing encounters for 1st edition Advanced Dungeons & Dragons adventures conveniently organized for online and tabletop use. Also compatible with OSRIC."

88338.description:
Kill Ball is a science fiction tabletop sports game for two players created by Gil Nicoll and Adam Watts. It uses tokens or minis on a gridded board to represent a match between two teams of human clones in a gritty arena environment.

Gameplay is an ultra-violent hybrid of handball and hockey. Clones are extremely disposable, and inflicting serious injuries and death upon the opponent’s team is a major part of the game’s strategy. A decapitation will add an additional ball to the arena which can also be used as weapon.

In leagues and tournaments, each player generates a unique team that carries on from game to game. Clones who suffer injuries or death in the arena will have temporary to permanent reductions to their stats, but are easily replaceable between matches. The ones that survive are awarded experience which can be used to improve attributes and purchase additional abilities.
88338.name: Kill Ball

88339.name: Dinner Party
88339.description: Players randomly and secretly pick a character from a pool of 10. Each player/character will host a dinner party consisting on a starter, a main dish, a dessert, drinks and entertainment all of them represented by cards with various choices of food, drink and entertainment. At the end of the game, each player will receive points from the rest depending on the various and particular tastes of their characters.

88340.name: Dungeon (Issue 179 - Jun 2010)
88340.description:
Cover by Kekai Kotaki

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88341.name: Hunger of the Iron Mage (Savage Worlds)
88341.description:
From the publisher's website:

“Weird Dave” Olson continues the adventure of our intrepid heroes with OSF#3. Suitable to pick up right where #2 left off or a great stand alone adventure....

Something lurks in the shadows beneath the mountain. Something hungry. A twisted secret from a lost dwarven hall creeps up from the depths, and a party of stalwart heroes must brave the dangers of the Jagged Reaches to put an end to its machinations. Will you take up the mantle of hero and face off against the horrors that dwell in the mountain’s shadow, or will you fall victim to...the hunger of the Iron Mage?

Hunger of the Iron Mage is designed for a party of four to six characters of any experience level, and serves as a continuation of the Old School Fantasy series, a nice one-off, or a side trek to drop into your ongoing fantasy campaign. It is an adventure filled with danger, adventure, an insane wizard, secret tunnels, and more troglodytes than you can shake a stick at. Remember those days when sometimes you just wanted to let your hair down, grab some dice, and have an excuse to kill things? Good. This one’s for you.

88342.name: Dungeon (Issue 180 - Jul 2010)
88342.description:
Cover by Tyler Walpole

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88343.name: G.M. Magazine (Issue 15 - Nov 1989)

rpgissue.4032: G.M. - The Independent Fantasy Roleplaying Magazine

88343.description:
Contents:

•News
•Iain M Banks Interview
•Scream Scene - Horror Games by Gary O'Connell
•Reviews
•Historical Alternatives
•Heroquest Competition
•Covention Corner
•LRP: Things that Shouldn't be
•Zine Scene by Wayne

•Books by Alan Crump
•The Paint Shop by Paul Benson
•Comics by Philip Morton
•PBM Update by Wayne
•The Axeman Cometh!
•Critical Hits by David Langford

88346.name: We Bowl
88346.description:
Compete with friends or roll solo with crazy power-ups, awesome avatars, and amazing prizes!

From the makers of Skee-Ball and Flick Fishing comes the newest Freeverse title We Bowl, the ultimate in arcade action! Create your custom avatar and hit the lanes to bowl with your friends or alone in pursuit of the perfect game. It’s fast paced and easy to play — just flick your finger down the lane!

Insane, game changing power-ups can transform head-to-head competition with friends instantly, or use them to level up and win great prizes. We Bowl is exciting, frenetic action — this ain’t your neighborhood bowling alley!

Source: The Developer Website.

88347.name: Corpse Craft
88347.description:
Ahem. Corpse Craft is a unique combination of puzzle and real-time strategy, set in an Edward Gorey-inspired world. With zombies. Try it for free on your iPad today!

Features

A dramatic tale of murder, mayhem, zombies, and schoolchildren!
Deep and accessible real-time strategy gameplay!
Bad poetry!
Multiplayer battles with Apple Game Center integration!
English accents!




Source: The Game Website.

88349.name: Grid Snakes
88349.description:
Grid Snakes is a quick-playing game with some real-world dexterity elements for two, four, or six players (with variant rules for three, five, and seven to twelve players). You’re a digital snake, trapped in an arena with several other snakes. As you move, you leave body segments behind you. Your goal is to eliminate your opponents by forcing your opponents to crash into the edge of the board or and section of any other player.

Play is simultaneous (so there's no down time) and proceeds through the following phases: plan, challenge, resolve. During planning, you have a just a handful seconds to pick a direction and a speed for your snake. When all instructions are revealed, any player may spend a token to challenge another player. If you're challenged, you have to flick a token onto a chart; where it lands dictates your speed for the turn. During resolution, you move the snakes, add body segments, and check for collisions.

Grid Snakes uses a large and a small custom board, several small custom decks of cards (eight cards each), some nickels or quarters, and a lot of colored glass beads (or other small tokens). The rules and cards are available at: http://www.invisible-city.com/file_download/165/

Grid Snakes has fairly simple rules, but requires quick decision making and planning. Grid Snakes is appropriate for ages 12 and up. If you eliminate the timer, you could probably play this game with slightly younger children. If you allow multiple attempts on reflex challenges, you could go even younger. A four-player game takes 30 minutes or fewer to play. A six-player game takes 40 minutes or fewer.

88350.name: Fenix (Volume 7, Issue 6 Nov 2010)
88350.description:
The main feature in this issue is the third and final part of the Operation Third Reich adventure Picnic in Poland

Contents (In Swedish)
3 Ledare
6 Nyhetssvep
9 Digitala drakar
12 Med Cataclysm går världen under World of Warcraft
14 Det bubblar i brädspelsbranchen

20 Konsten att få en roll att spela roll

46 Recensioner reviews
66 Den vinnande Westernrollen

88351.name: Dungeon (Issue 181 - Aug 2010)

rpgissuearticle.22419: Campaign Workbook: The Shrine of the Sea Demon

88351.description:
Cover by Daarken

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88352.name: Freeport Companion: Pathfinder RPG Edition

rpgissuearticle.49813: Twenty Questions with Greg A. Vaughan !

88352.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For a decade now Freeport has stood as one of fantasy gaming's most distinctive cities. Home to pirates, foul cults, terrifying monsters, vicious gangs, crime lords, and corrupt politicians, Freeport is a dynamic setting that offers a unique blend of high adventure and cosmic horror. Now the City of Adventure returns to its roots with the Freeport Companion: Pathfinder RPG Edition, a rules supplement for the Pirate's Guide to Freeport. Its 160 pages are packed with all the support you need to run a Freeport campaign with the Pathfinder RPG. In addition to giving game stats for all the city's major characters, the Freeport Companion provides new core classes like the corsair and monster hunter, new prestige classes like the musketeer and witch hunter, famous magic items, an insanity system, new spells and incantations, and an introductory adventure. Celebrate 10 years of the City of Adventure with the Freeport Companion: Pathfinder RPG Edition!

88353.name: Dungeon (Issue 182 - Sep 2010)

rpgissuearticle.22464: Blood and Dragonshards: Backdrop: Q'Barra, Part 1

88353.description:
Cover by Larry Elmore

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88354.description:
The finalists of the RoboRally tournament which transpired at the Origins Game Fair in 1999 each received a copy of the King of the Hill board. While it is virtually impossible to obtain an original, the fan community has produced an accurate print-and-play version available for download.

King of the Hill incorporates various elements from previous expansions published by Wizards of the Coast—most notably being one of only three boards to utilize ramps and ledges—while exclusively featuring the 'steep ramp' element which, unlike normal ramps, requires three movements worth of momentum in order to ascend.
88354.name: RoboRally: King of the Hill

88355.name: Wild Cards: Aces & Jokers
88355.description:
Publisher Blurb:

With well over a dozen books and more on the way, the Wild Cards fiction series has a cast of characters too large to be covered in just one book. Aces & Jokers fills out the roster from the Wild Cards Campaign Setting with biographical and game information on dozens of aces, jokers, and nats from the series, everything you need to fill out the ranks in your own Mutants & Masterminds game. As a bonus, you can use the character stats in this book for other settings as well, providing you with ready-made villains, heroes, and other characters. Get ready to double up with Aces & Jokers!

88356.name: Dungeon (Issue 183 - Oct 2010)
88356.description:
Cover by Wayne Reynolds

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88357.name: Dungeon (Issue 184 - Nov 2010)
88357.description:
Cover by Lucas Graciano

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

88358.name: Monster Truck Madness
88358.description:
A racing game, Monster Truck Madness allows players to select between the 12 real life monster trucks and compete with AI players in one of four modes - drag (based on PENDA Point Series), circuit, rally and tournament. It is also possible for human players to race against one another via DirectPlay.

Source: Wikipedia, "Monster Truck Madness", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88359.name: The Simpsons Skateboarding
88359.description:
User Summary

Skate around Springfield and test your skills. play as some of your favorite characters around some Springfield landmarks

88360.name: The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles
88360.description:
User Summary

Based on the TV series of the same name, this game puts the player in the shoes of a young Indiana Jones. The game is a side-scrolling action title where Indy gets to fight bad guys and collect treasure.

88361.name: Xexyz
88361.description:
The game centers around the main character of Apollo (no relation to the Greek sun god) who progresses through the game in an alternating format that switches between platform, side-scrolling action (similar to the Super Mario Bros. series) and side-scrolling shooter action (similar to Konami's Gradius series). The goal of the series is, stereotypically, to destroy an evil boss — Goruza — rescue a princess — in this case, Princess Maria — and save the planet.

In the platforming levels, defeated enemies drop life ('L' blocks) or money ('E' blocks) powerups. Apollo collects the currency of the land ('Balls'/'E Ball') in order to exchange for acquiring power-ups and information, as well as access to minigames. Vendors are scattered throughout the platforming levels through doors or hidden gates. In the shooter levels, 'S' and 'P' oblongs are found that upgrade speed and weapons, respectively.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://www.wikipedia.com/Xexyz,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88362.name: WWF Wrestlemania: Steel Cage Challenge
88362.description:
WWF WrestleMania: Steel Cage Challenge is a professional wrestling video game based on the World Wrestling Federation, released in 1992 by Acclaim Entertainment for the NES and Sega Master System gaming systems, and the Sega Game Gear handheld console. Modes include One-on-One (regular match and steel cage match variations), Tag Team, WWF Championship (choose one wrestler and defeat all the others to become WWF Champion), and Tag Team Championship (choose two wrestlers and defeat combinations of the rest in a series of tag team matches to become WWF Tag Team Champions).

The NES version features ten wrestlers: Hulk Hogan, Randy Savage, I.R.S., Ted DiBiase, Jake Roberts, Roddy Piper, Bret Hart, Sid Justice, The Undertaker, and The Mountie.

The Sega versions also feature ten wrestlers: Hulk Hogan, Randy Savage, I.R.S., Ted DiBiase, Ric Flair, Tatanka, Bret Hart, Papa Shango, The Undertaker, and Shawn Michaels.

All wrestlers share the same moveset, consisting of standard punches and kicks, grapples (body slam, throw, headbutt), running attacks (flying clothesline, dropkick), a powerslam to a running opponent, ground attacks (stomp, elbow drop) and a move off the turnbuckle. There are no finishing moves. However, this was the first console-based WWF game to feature a steel cage match (cage matches had previously been seen in the arcade game WWF WrestleFest).

Source: Wikipedia, "http://www.wikipedia.com/WWF_WrestleMania:_Steel_Cage_Challenge," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88363.name: WWF King of the Ring
88363.description:
WWF King of the Ring is a professional wrestling video game based on the World Wrestling Federation, released in 1993 for the Nintendo Entertainment System and Game Boy. In this game, players can vie for the title of King of the Ring by competing in an eight-man single elimination tournament. Additionally, players can battle the entire roster through a string of singles matches to become WWF Champion. Also available are exhibition matches in singles and tag team modes for one or two players.

The NES version features eleven wrestlers: Hulk Hogan, Randy Savage, Bret Hart, The Undertaker, "The Narcissist" Lex Luger, Mr. Perfect, Razor Ramon, Shawn Michaels, Yokozuna, Bam Bam Bigelow and "You".

Each of the game's wrestlers possess the same basic moveset, consisting of punches, kicks, a body slam, a suplex, a throw, a dropkick, stomps, elbow drops, and a move off the turnbuckle. There are no signature moves. However, each wrestler varies in speed, strength, and stamina attributes.

Source: Wikipedia, "WWF King of the Ring," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88364.name: Wurm: Journey to the Center of the Earth
88364.description:
W.U.R.M.: Journey to the Center of the Earth, released in Japan as Vazolder: The Underground Battle Space​ (地底戦空バゾルダー, Chitei Sen Kū Bazorudā?), is a multi-genre video game released for the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1991 by Asmik.

The plot deals with mysterious earthquakes, and the government dispatches explorers in powerful digging machines called VZR's (nicknamed WURMs, but the name is never used in the game). The player controls Moby, the leader of one VZR's crew. She and her friends discover that two races of subterranean humans have been fighting a war underground. More characters join the crew over the course of the game.

WURM has a variety of different styles of play, with side-scrolling travel stages in the VZR, overhead shooting levels, levels where Moby leaves the vehicle to explore underground ruins, and first-person shooting levels with boss monsters.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://www.wikipedia.com/Wurm:_Journey_To_The_Center_Of_The_Earth," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88365.name: World Champ
88365.description:
World Champ, known in Japan as Great Boxing: Rush Up (グレートボクシングラッシュアップ), is a 1990 boxing game developed and published in Japan by Visco for the Nintendo Family Computer, and was later published in North America by Romstar for the Nintendo Entertainment System.

Source: Wikipedia, "World Champ," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88366.name: Wolverine
88366.description:
Wolverine is an action video game developed by Software Creations and published by LJN for the NES, and was released exclusively in North America in 1991. It is a licensed game based on the Marvel Comics super-hero of the same name, as well as the X-Men.

Player controls Wolverine, who has been imprisoned on a vast island, through various stages, in to finally battle evil mutants Magneto and Sabretooth. Along with icons to restore health, or to gain extra lives, special icons can be located to allow other X-Men characters, such as Jubilee, Havok, and Psylocke to offer advice or temporary aid.

Wolverine's basic moves are jumping, ducking, punching, and kicking. He can bring out his legendary powerful claws with a push of the "Select" button, but every time the claws are used his energy is depleted. Energy is regained by consuming food and beverages, such as hamburgers and soft drinks. If you kill enough minor characters, Wolverine will temporarily shift into a "Berzerker" mode.

Unlike many other NES games, where the player character is given a grace period of invulnerability after sustaining damage, Wolverine's energy is simply drained for as long as he is in contact with an enemy or hazard. Another difference is the fact that at the end of a level, except for the final one, there is no boss to defeat and no effort is made to explain how the indoor and outdoor themed levels manage to fit onto an uncharted island.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wolverine (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88368.name: Win, Lose or Draw
88368.description:
Hi Tech Expressions released two editions of the DOS version of the game in 1988 plus a Junior Version, followed by a Nintendo version in 1989. Both versions of this party game featured a scene set in a living room, with the game contestants (representing real-life players) seated on opposite couches, much like the television show. While the game system drew a picture on the screen, one of the players would have a limited amount (60 seconds for the main game, and 90 for the speed round) of time to type in the word or phrase represented by the image. If the player typed in the incorrect answer, a player on the opposing team would have an opportunity to type the correct answer (in single-player games, the game system would type a random incorrect answer). The team that typed the correct answer would win money for that round. The team that earned the most money at the end of the game won.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://www.wikipedia.com/Win,_Lose_or_Draw#Home_versions,&qu...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88369.name: Chairman of the Board
88369.description:
Object: Become Chairman of the Board, the winner must have a minimum of 51% of the stock of his company and a minimum score of $255,000. The highest score wins.

Players take turns picking up a Situation card, adding or subtracting value to the score sheet and/or move along the gameboard. Some cards allow you to choose between increasing/decreasing your net worth or moving your playing piece forwards/backwards while other cards will have you to both.

The are other squares on the gameboard which involve Conflict/Advantage cards and Corporate Investment cards. Conflict/Advantage cards are played when picked up. These cards are similar to the Situation cards but some are Advantage cards which can cause other people to lose a percent of their income, move backwards and other 'take-that' actions.

Corporate Investment cards are kept face down and typically add to your wealth but amounts vary. They are added in towards the end of the game.

Contents include game board, score sheet, 4 player pawns, 72 situation cards, 35 conflict/advantage cards, 30 corporate cards, and insert with the instructions on them

88370.name: Trial of Echoed Souls (4E)
88370.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The heroes stand poised to seize control of their fates and the ongoing war, but only if they are the first to claim the Torch of the Burning Sky.

Seeking the legendary artifact of Emperor Coaltongue, the heroes explore a haunted forest and must face its dangers while contending with patrls sent by two armies, who are racing to capture it. From there, the heroes must travel to a sentient psionic temple, where they face shadows of their past in a physical and mental trial that could alter their very beings.

Can the heroes locate the Torch of the Burning Sky, and do they have what it takes to undergo the Trial of Echoed Souls?

For Character Levels 19--20.

88371.name: Imagine Master's Manual
88371.description:
From the back of the book:

"The Imagine Master's Manual is the realization of a great undertaking. Mammoth in scope, size and sheer information, it is the perfect complement to the Imagine Player's Guide. Inside this tome, Game Masters and Players alike will find all the keys they need to breathe life into what is a new dimension of gaming. Create and destroy new worlds, monsters, classes, races and anything else you can think of.

So don't just sit there...

Unlock the full potential of your game.

Can you Imagine..."

88372.name: Imagine Player's Manual
88372.description:
From the back of the book:

The Imagine Player's Guide is the culmination of years of work and development. Never before has anyone combined fun, creativity and playability into a role playing game of this caliber. Imagine a world limited only by the bounds of your mind. Imagine a game unlike any you have played before. Imagine no more, we have made it a reality.

Can you imagine...

Introducing:


12 Attributes
18 Races
26 Classes
Over 340 Skills
More than 450 Spells and Invocations
Over 150 Different Weapons and Armor
More than 500 Items of Equipment


Now if you dare, discover what role playing is all about.

88373.name: Wild Gunman

videogamefranchise.28200: NES Black Box (1980s NES Games, US)

88373.description:
Wild Gunman (ワイルドガンマン, Wairudo Ganman) is a light gun game created by Nintendo.

The original version was one of Nintendo's early electro-mechanical arcade games released in 1974. It consisted of a light gun connected to a 16mm projection screen. An image of a Wild West gunslinger was projected onto the screen and when his eyes flashed, the player needed to draw and shoot. If the player was fast enough the projection would change to that of the shot gunman falling down, otherwise it would show the gunman drawing and firing his gun. A piece of Chopin's "Funeral March" indicates the player's defeat.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wild Gunman," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88374.name: Widget
88374.description:
Widget action-platforming video game created for the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1990 developed and published by Atlus. It is based on the cartoon series Widget the World Watcher, starring a purple alien named Widget who has the unique ability to transform into other versions of himself, including a golem, a cannon, a bird and a speedy mouse. It also had a sequel by the name of Super Widget on the Super NES.

Source: Wikipedia, "Widget (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88376.name: Sonic Rush Adventure
88376.description:
From the back of the case

"A high-speed, high seas adventure!

Race island-to-island as Sonic or Blaze on a wild and dizzying hunt for lost treasure! Dive into deep sea caves, outrun an avalanche and battle with pirates as you blast through 14 action-packed levels with 100 unlockable missions!

Get vertical while pulling off tons of moves and tricks.

Battle Captain Whisker and other mega bosses!

Find 16 hidden islands filled with secret treasures."

88377.name: Identik "Pizza Hut"- mini-expansion
88377.description:
Mini-expansion included in Pizza Hut's "Helaba!"-magazine no 43. (magazine edited in Belgium for Pizza Hut)
This mini-expansion has 2 new cards for the game "Identik":
The dutch cards are:
- Sliertenbezweerder (stringscharmer)
- Dolle koeien (mad cows)
- Tussendoortje (snack)
- De beste vriend van de hond (a dog's best friend)

88378.name: Microlite20: Expert Rules
88378.description:
From the opening of the PDF:

This rule-set allows for introducing a few more options to your Microlite20 game, without necessarily increasing its complexity. Included are: a new skill, new races, new classes, and some other (hopefully) good stuff. It is not necessary to use Microlite20 Expert Rules in its entirety; DMs are encouraged to "cherry pick" those specific items applicable to their own campaign. Requires the use of Microlite20.

88379.name: Burger Tower
88379.description:
User Summary

In Burger Tower, you control a sheep chef. You must run from side to side of the game screen, capturing ingredients falling from the sky, to create the ultimate burger.

88380.name: Doodle Squares
88380.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Doodle Squares HD is a simple and fun arcade game which you can play anywhere you want, on any device that you want. Try to survive as long as possible while collecting as many black squares as you can to increase your score. Collect different types of cool powerups to help you survive longer and achieve a better score. Just stay away from the dangerous red squares and you’ll be fine…

A short tutorial is included on first launch to help you with your first steps. Publish your score on Facebook and/or Twitter to show your friends what you’re made of. You can also automatically submit your score to our global leaderboards and compete against the world’s best doodlers.

This is one of the first truly universal games: It is optimized for the iPad, the iPhone4 retina display as well as any other iPhone or iPod Touch model. All graphics are available in the appropriate resolution on each device to enhance your gaming experience. You can also play in any orientation you want, be it portrait or landscape. Play while lying down, standing up, or in any other position that you like, the game always adjusts and lets you continue playing without stopping
